As a result, she becomes increasingly frustrated with mild-mannered fiance Max, and wonders how much longer she can continue the charade of their happy relationship - but just how far is she willing to go to end it? programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys from Maltby to Hinckley, going whippet racing and trying to understand the appeal of Marmite, before a look around the Triumph motorcycle factory

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from the Highcliffe Castle in Dorset, a 19th century castle that has been restored using all kinds of ingenious methods

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jennie McAlpine, Ugo Monye, Joe Pasquale and Felicity Ward test their general knowledge skills in the penultimate series of challenges

programme.title: Marcus Wareing's Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The chef rediscovers some wasabi plants in his kitchen garden, and decides to find out more, including how to grow them at the UK's only wasabi farm. Back on home turf, Marcus checks on his ducks and gathers up a glut of lavender to take to local gelato-maker, Grant

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: The Weltklasse Zurich. Coverage of the 11th meeting of the campaign, held at Letzigrund in Switzerland. Many of the stars of the recent World Championships are expected to be in action, and it was two of the planet's leading sprinters who took the headlines last year, with Noah Lyles winning the men's 200m in a meeting record of 19.52 second and Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce equalling the mark of 10.65 set by Elaine Thompson-Herah a year earlier in the women's 100m

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn just around the corner, Adam Frost takes stock of his garden and plans ahead for some late-season interest under the supervision of Ash the cat. Frances Tophill visits a garden in Kent where the plants provide a non-stop buffet for insects, while Nick Bailey travels to Cornwall to revel in the glory of hardy palms

programme.title: No Activity
programme.desc: Hendy and Stokes are joined on their stakeout by a witness, in the hope that she can identify a suspect. Nearby, Bruce and Jimmy are reunited as Bruce is released from hospital in much better health than expected. April gets to meet Lachy for the first time after Carol brings him to work

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.desc: Fats Timbo, a model, dancer and content creator, reveals what life as a 4ft woman is really like

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Christine learns what's hiding underneath her resentment. Erica connects with Sean. Brock and Kristi reach a potential breaking point

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: Sparks fly as the contenders clash over plans for a multi-themed wedding, and with two venues to arrange it turns out to be the toughest challenge yet. Can they pull together and impress judges Sara Davies, Fred Sirieix and Raj Somaiya?

programme.title: T20 Cricket
programme.desc: Action from the first in the three-match series, held at the 1st Central County Ground in Hove

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The Dive team are called out to Brighton Marina's main jetty which is on a tilt, combined with the low tide it threatens to fall down on young diver Kai's head. Plus, an oil tanker the size of two football pitches is inspected inch by inch before it's allowed to set sail

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The chef turns his attention to street food which is experiencing a boom when the industry is struggling. In the West Midlands, Tom meets Jack Brabant and James Swinburne, founders of an expanding street food collective called Digbeth Dining Club. They curate street food events and venues, bringing together the best independent local traders with DJs and live music to create a new kind of dining experience

programme.title: Crazy Rich Agents: Selling Dream Homes
programme.desc: Georgie assures her fellow brokers that she has clients who are interested in a beautiful country house, but where does it leave her when the potential buyers don't even show up? Vanesa didn't get any offers from her open house in Monaco and is now worried that her mother is going to cut her off, while Krish is not convinced about working in London and meets up with an old contact from Leicester. The millionaire entrepreneur is looking for a new family home, but he has a very specific list of criteria and is refusing to share exactly what they are with Krish

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple find a property in Pembrokeshire with holiday let potential. Plus, some entrepreneurs who turned a derelict farmhouse into a B&B

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Will Kirk is entrusted with the restoration of a cherished family crib, Dominic Chinea hopes to rejuvenate a rusted pogo stick that's lost its spring, while Chris Shaw attempts to reassemble the pages of a dilapidated cookbook. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants for pollinators in the wildlife garden, takes succulent leaf cuttings and continues the summer vegetable harvest. Carol Klein visits Italian-influenced gardens in Gloucestershire and Rekha Mistry reveals the latest triumphs and disasters in her new garden in the Peak District

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Rachel Burden takes viewers' calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin is in Surrey as chef Jonathan Jones and hospitality consultant Richard Arman use their own cash to buy and sell antiques to try to make the most profit

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The contest comes to an all-singing all-dancing climax with a banquet celebrating Britain's success in pop music at London's Abbey Road Studios. Ahead of the chefs is the challenge of cooking in a kitchen they don't know as well as having to scale up their dishes to provide the highest calibre of dining. Plus, in a Great British Menu first, they have to adapt their dishes for vegetarian diners. Those attending include Andrew Ridgeley, Martin Kemp, Keisha Buchanan, Peter Hook and Gary 'Mani' Mounfield

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist investigates two shells that have proved to be winners in evolution - the bird's egg shell and the hard shell of the tortoise. The ostrich egg is so strong it is possible for it to take a person's weight without breaking - so how does a chick manage break out of such a fortress? The evolution of the tortoise shell was for a long time a mystery, and this bony box offers a lot more than just protection

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his Bradshaw's guide, Michael Portillo reaches Birmingham and discovers how a radical reformer made his mark on the 'city of a thousand trades'. At Highbury Hall, he finds Joseph Chamberlain's mansion home and hears how he established a political dynasty including a prime minister and a foreign secretary. Next stop is Cradley Heath, once one of five chain-making towns in the West Midlands. At the centre of Britain's ceramic industry in Stoke-on-Trent, Michael visits Wedgwood, established by 'Queen's Potter' Josiah Wedgwood in 1759 and visited in 1913 by King George V and Queen Mary

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Michael Baggott and Adam Partridge inspect a collection of medals and a pewter bowl brought in by members of the public looking to make a sale at Derbyshire's Haddon Hall. Plus, presenter Paul Martin takes a look at 20th-century British art depicting conflicts at the Imperial War Museum

programme.title: Live International T20 Cricket
programme.desc: England v New Zealand. All the action from the second match in the four-game series, which comes from Emirates Old Trafford in Manchester. The sides have met here in this format on two previous occasions, with England winning by nine wickets in the first ever T20 international staged at this venue in 2008, and prevailing again by 56 runs in 2015 with the help of a fine innings of 68 from Joe Root. Isa Guha presents, with analysis from Michael Vaughan, James Anderson and Ebony Rainford-Brent

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The ship exceeds the speed of light, allowing the crew to see echoes of future events, but while Rimmer gets a pleasant surprise, Lister is shocked to see what appears to be his own violent death. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Danny John-Jules

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Sima Kotecha

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Cricket's Greatest Game
programme.desc: A documentary examining one of the sporting world's best loved games

programme.title: Murder Trial: The Disappearance of Renee and Andrew MacRae
programme.desc: First of a two-part programme giving an account of one of the biggest unsolved murder cases in Scottish legal history. On trial at Inverness High Court is 80-year-old William MacDowell, who stands accused of killing his former lover Renee MacRae and her three-year-old son in 1976, disposing of their bodies and concealing the murders for 45 years. With in-court access to one of the most long-awaited court cases in Scotland's history, the documentary sits alongside both prosecution and defence as they detail the dramatic twists and turns of this shocking case

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Rob Rinder go behind the scenes at Nusfjord Arctic Resort, a preserved 200-year-old cod-fishing village in the Lofoten Islands of Norway. Working alongside the dedicated staff, Monica and Rob learn to appreciate the difficulties of running a high-end resort in such an extreme environment as they battle snowy paths with housekeeping, face huge waves on fishing boats and chase the Northern Lights

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Brock and Kristi return from a blissful vacation only to be crushed by reality. Orna has a breakthrough with Sean. Josh and Natasha make a surprising turn

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon examine the online reviews that may not be all they appear and offer advice on spotting the real from the fake. Plus, travel expert Simon Calder shares tips, advice and insights

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels and Duggee meet a lion with bad breath

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels meet a chameleon

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: The Veggies are delighted with a new tablet they've found, but when they're not looking, Evil Pea turns it to evil mode and it soon takes over the supermarket

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun and Bitzer work together to track down a nut thief

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Dennis and his mates rebel against an outbreak of fun-killing rules that are being imposed on Beanotown

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: The kids visit an eco camp to learn how to grow vegetables. Unfortunately, the Smith twins are also there and have no intention of pulling their weight

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Ant searches a chasm for clues to his grandparents' fate

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: History buff Hector from Wigan is a huge fan of William Shakespeare and wants a space of his own where he can store all his history books, write plays and enjoy his hero's works

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: The three brothers are on a mission to compose a zoo musical using the sounds of the animals

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing professional Graziano Di Prima set the presenters a dance challenge, while Joel heads to Blackpool with a magic superfan, and chef Jamie Oliver earns his very own gold Blue Peter badge

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall dives with hammerhead and tiger sharks, exploring how to save them from extinction

programme.title: Super Cute Animals
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan embarks on a global journey to find some of the world's cutest animals, aiming to understand why people find them so endearing and revealing the surprising science behind each creature. He begins with the giant panda, whose unusually large head tells a story of millions of years of evolution and survival. Gordon also reveals how the fennec fox's ears are crucial to its survival, discovers the surprising secret behind a penguin's waddle and meets a five-year-old chimpanzee whose giggle reveals new information about man's evolution

programme.title: Britain's Secret Seas
programme.desc: Explorer Paul Rose teams up with biologist Tooni Mahto and underwater archaeologist Frank Pope to explore the secrets of the waters surrounding Britain. The trio begin by highlighting marine life in and around the western seas, including basking sharks off the Cornish shore and spider crabs in the shallows of south Wales, as well as creatures in a protected area around Lundy Island off the Devon coast

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: The Wanda Diamond League Xiamen. Live coverage of the 12th meeting of the season, held at Egret Stadium in China. This is the first time Xiamen has hosts a Diamond League event, with the meetings in this country typically taking place at Shanghai, and many of the world's biggest names are expected to compete in the state-of-the-art venue

programme.title: Scott of the Antarctic (1948)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama following explorer Robert Falcon Scott's failed expedition to be the first to reach the South Pole. The extreme conditions, poor decision-making and the pressure of the race to make it to the Pole before their Norwegian rivals proved too much for the British team, resulting in tragedy in 1912. Starring John Mills, Derek Bond, James Robertson Justice, Kenneth More and John Gregson

programme.title: Our Wild Adventures
programme.desc: BBC wildlife presenters and crew take a trip through the natural history archives, beginning by sharing some of their most memorable animal encounters across Africa. Gordon Buchanan reminisces about the start of his career when he was 17, Chris Packham looks back on of his adventures in Kenya, and Steve Backshall shares a story about diving with Nile crocodiles in the Okavango delta of Botswana

programme.title: Marcus Wareing's Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The chef ventures out to Romney Marshes to meet shepherd Chris to learn what gives salt-marsh lamb its flavour, and visits a nearby school that has set up its own farm

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jennie McAlpine, Ugo Monye, Joe Pasquale and Felicity Ward test their general knowledge skills before the week's winner is revealed by Richard Osman

programme.title: Fantasy Film Music at the Proms
programme.desc: Award-winning actress Hannah Waddingham hosts an evening of magical soundtracks from film, TV and gaming's greatest fantasy, myths and legends. Anna-Maria Helsing conducts the BBC Concert Orchestra and the Huddersfield Choral Societ in music from the Harry Potter, Star Wars and Lord of the Rings film franchises, as well as Game of Thrones, World of Warcraft, Good Omens and His Dark Materials

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: A selection of performances by some of the most popular all-girl groups to have appeared on the show, from the pop-soul vocal ensembles of the 1960s to the glamorous bands of the new millennium. Includes songs by the Supremes, Labelle, TLC, Spice Girls, the Pointer Sisters and B*Witched

programme.title: Bananarama at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by the pop group, featuring many of the 25 Top 40 singles they released over their career. It's a selection that covers those early days when the Fun Boy Three first introduced pop fans to the original line-up of Keren Woodward, Sara Dallin and Siobhan Fahey on It Ain't What You Do, as well as the end of the 1980s when Siobhan left and was replaced by Jacquie O'Sullivan

programme.title: Girls Aloud: Tangled Up Live from the O2
programme.desc: Footage of the band's 2008 tour, filmed at the O2 Arena in London. Songs include Love Machine, Biology, Call the Shots and Sound of the Underground

programme.title: Labelle in Concert
programme.desc: The American funk rock band perform a selection of their songs in this 1975 concert - their first appearance on British TV

programme.title: The Spice Girls at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of performances by the group on BBC shows from over the years, from their breakout number one Wannabe through to their final release Headlines. There are also hits the members enjoyed when they launched themselves as solo stars, including Mel B and Missy Elliott's I Want You Back and Melanie C's duet with Bryan Adams on When You're Gone

programme.title: Pop Life
programme.desc: A look at life within all-female bands- a heady and combustible mix of talent, ambition and hairspray. Those lifting the lid on a life of girl power, baby love and walking like Egyptians are members of the Spice Girls, Bananarama, Girls Aloud, the Bangles, Sister Sledge, the Ronettes and the Supremes

programme.title: T20 Cricket
programme.desc: Action from the second in the three-match series, held at the Cloud County Ground in Chelmsford

programme.title: The Woman in the Wall
programme.desc: Mystery, starring Ruth Wilson as Lorna Brady, who wakes from sleepwalking to find a corpse in her house. She has no idea who the dead woman is or if she's responsible for the apparent murder. Re-tracing her steps, Lorna realises that the mysterious woman could be linked to her past in the town's Magdalene Laundry. Meanwhile in Dublin, Detective Colman Akande is confronted with the murder of a local priest. Tracking the case brings him into Lorna's orbit

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels the length of the Northumbrian coastline, with its glorious beaches and grandiose castles. In the village of Alnmouth he takes to the waves in a traditional skiff built by members of the Alnmouth Coastal Rowing Club. His last stop of the day is the mighty Bamburgh Castle

programme.title: Climbing Great Buildings
programme.desc: Jonathan Foyle climbs the spires of New College, Oxford, a building constructed in 1379 that set the blueprint for universities all over the world. He investigates how the Black Death led to an architectural innovation and reveals how the quadrangle originated here. He also discovers carvings of English folk tales in the chapel and learns how a glazing technique helped create the medieval stained glass

programme.title: How We Tamed the Cat and Dog
programme.desc: Documentary examining archaeology and genetics to answer questions about cats, including where they came from and how they ended up living with humans. The programme examines how to read felines' enigmatic facial expressions, and studies the unusual behaviour of domestic pets that have turned feral

programme.title: In the Heat of the Night (1967)
programme.desc: When a wealthy industrialist is murdered in Mississippi, the bigoted local sheriff is quick to accuse a black newcomer to town - only to learn his suspect is a highly respected homicide detective from Philadelphia. However, the duo are forced to put aside their mutual loathing and team up to track down the killer. Oscar-winning drama, starring Sidney Poitier, Rod Steiger and Warren Oates

programme.title: Scene By Scene
programme.desc: Mark Cousins interviews Rod Steiger, star of numerous classics including On the Waterfront, Dr Zhivago, Oklahoma, The Pawnbroker and In the Heat of the Night. Never a conventional leading man, Steiger nevertheless changed the direction of movies and opened the way for the distinctive performances of Robert de Niro, who referred to him as the most important actor of his generation

programme.title: For a Few Dollars More (1965)
programme.desc: An enigmatic gunslinger forms an uneasy alliance with a military veteran to track down a notorious outlaw - but tensions simmer as their very different motives for the hunt put them increasingly at odds. Sergio Leone's Western sequel, starring Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Gian Maria Volonte, Josef Egger, Mara Krup and Klaus Kinski

programme.title: Secret Life of Farm Animals
programme.desc: Documentary examining the behaviour of farm animals, testing their intelligence, discovering unlikely relationships and uncovering a side to them that may never have been seen before. The first film focuses on sheep, following 12 weeks in the life of a lamb on a Welsh hill farm, and revealing them to be highly sociable with a remarkable ability to recognise each other and human faces too. Other animals featured include a lonely goose looking for company and a piglet that thinks it is a cow

programme.title: How We Tamed the Cat and Dog
programme.desc: Documentary examining archaeology and genetics to answer questions about cats, including where they came from and how they ended up living with humans. The programme examines how to read felines' enigmatic facial expressions, and studies the unusual behaviour of domestic pets that have turned feral

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Femi Oke and Mark Franklin present the edition first shown on September 3, featuring performances by Bananarama, the Shamen, Sonia, Dr Alban, Lionel Richie, U96, Sinad O'Connor and Snap

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Gary Davies presents the programme, first broadcast on September 4. Featuring the Communards, MC Miker 'G' and Deejay Sven, Bruce Hornsby and the Range, Bon Jovi, Farley 'Jackmaster' Funk, Frankie Goes to Hollywood, and Boris Gardiner

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: Europe's first majority black and ethnically diverse orchestra Chineke! returns to the Royal Albert Hall with Beethoven's joyful Fourth Symphony, performed under conductor Anthony Parnther. Before the Beethoven, novelty is the uniting factor, with four pieces enjoying their Proms debuts, including the lyrical Four Noveletten by Samuel Coleridge-Taylor. Plus, trumpeter-on-the-rise Aaron Azunda Akugbo takes centre stage to perform Haydn's joyful Trumpet Concerto, with its famous third movement. Clara Amfo presents, with special guests Hannah French and Ayanna Witter-Johnson

programme.title: Bon Jovi in Concert
programme.desc: A 2013 concert from the intimate confines of the BBC Radio Theatre, in which Jon Bon Jovi, Richie Sambora, David Bryan and Tico Torres perform classics from six albums across their band's 30-year reign. Songs include Slippery When Wet, Crush, Have a Nice Day, Lost Highway and The Circle as well as material from their album What About Now, newly released at the time of recording

programme.title: The Proclaimers Live at Stirling Castle
programme.desc: The duo's concert at the 2012 Hogmanay celebrations on the esplanade of the castle, when they performed a selection of their best-loved tracks including Letter from America, Life with You and I'm Gonna Be (500 miles)

programme.title: Deacon Blue Live at Stirling Castle
programme.desc: A performance by the Scottish group recorded at Hogmanay 2014 at Stirling Castle, featuring a set of their greatest hits amid the celebratory atmosphere of revellers seeing in the New Year

programme.title: 6 Music Live
programme.desc: With a career spanning over 30 years, Chrissie Hynde and her band returned to the fore in 2016 with a new album Alone, their first in eight years, with Dan Auerbach from the Black Keys on producing duties. This performance, staged at Maida Vale, is introduced by Mark Radcliffe

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Femi Oke and Mark Franklin present the edition first shown on September 3, featuring performances by Bananarama, the Shamen, Sonia, Dr Alban, Lionel Richie, U96, Sinad O'Connor and Snap

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Gary Davies presents the programme, first broadcast on September 4. Featuring the Communards, MC Miker 'G' and Deejay Sven, Bruce Hornsby and the Range, Bon Jovi, Farley 'Jackmaster' Funk, Frankie Goes to Hollywood, and Boris Gardiner

programme.title: Bon Jovi in Concert
programme.desc: A 2013 concert from the intimate confines of the BBC Radio Theatre, in which Jon Bon Jovi, Richie Sambora, David Bryan and Tico Torres perform classics from six albums across their band's 30-year reign. Songs include Slippery When Wet, Crush, Have a Nice Day, Lost Highway and The Circle as well as material from their album What About Now, newly released at the time of recording

programme.title: 6 Music Live
programme.desc: With a career spanning over 30 years, Chrissie Hynde and her band returned to the fore in 2016 with a new album Alone, their first in eight years, with Dan Auerbach from the Black Keys on producing duties. This performance, staged at Maida Vale, is introduced by Mark Radcliffe

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: Scientists and wildlife film-makers led by Steve Backshall, George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan explore Mount Bosavi, a giant extinct volcano covered by thick and largely unexplored rainforest in New Guinea. With the help of trackers from a remote tribe, they search for rare creatures and species to find evidence that may help stop the area's trees being felled for timber. The nest of the world's smallest parrot, an unusual beetle and new types of frog, gecko and bat are among the team's first discoveries

programme.title: Ray Mears' Northern Wilderness
programme.desc: The survival expert continues to explore the Canadian wilderness and learns about the history of the Hudson's Bay Company, which dealt in fur and was established in 1670. Ray examines the skills used by the business's early traders and trappers, gaining an insight into how they laid the foundations for modern Canada

programme.title: DNA
programme.desc: The health of Maria and Thorstein's baby improves and they are able to put the transplant on hold. Rolf travels to France to chase up a lead from one of the impounded phones and seeks help from his French colleague Claire. Neel questions a former footballer who owns the temping agency and Mario tries to find his sister at a brothel. In Danish

programme.title: DNA
programme.desc: Julita visits Rolf in Denmark, in search of the truth about her daughter. Neel questions the employees at Work-Force and Claire finds a connection between a travel agency and a Danish organisation. In Danish

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson welcomes Dr Jacob Bronowski, the presenter and writer of the 1973 documentary series The Ascent of Man. The academic shares his first impressions on arriving in England in the 1920s, his memories of filming at Auschwitz and his thoughts on science and his broader philosophy of life. First shown in February 1974

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: Highlights of Michael Parkinson's interviews with leading actresses Bette Midler, Lauren Bacall, Ingrid Bergman, Bette Davis, Raquel Welch, Shirley MacLaine, Gloria Swanson and Miss Piggy

programme.title: Oppenheimer
programme.desc: December 1953, and Oppenheimer has been accused of being a Soviet agent. The President has cancelled his security clearance until his case is fully investigated, leaving the scientist to choose between resignation or a security hearing. Starring Sam Waterston

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: Frank survives an accident-prone journey to see Betty in hospital - and the medical staff soon find themselves wishing he'd arrived as a patient rather than a visitor. Michael Crawford, Michele Dotrice and Elisabeth Sladen star

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker is challenged to convince Sir Humphrey that a computer holding vital citizen information could raise concerns about people's rights to privacy. Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne star

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Shadow minister Peter Mannion is due to visit to check out the department before the general election - which is yet another distraction for Nicola on a day when nothing seems to be going right. However, while trying to force Glenn and Olly to kick-start her new initiative, she receives an important call. Political comedy, with Rebecca Front and guest star Roger Allam

programme.title: Scene By Scene
programme.desc: Mark Cousins interviews Rod Steiger, star of numerous classics including On the Waterfront, Dr Zhivago, Oklahoma, The Pawnbroker and In the Heat of the Night. Never a conventional leading man, Steiger nevertheless changed the direction of movies and opened the way for the distinctive performances of Robert de Niro, who referred to him as the most important actor of his generation

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: A magpie's nest fills up with stolen items from around the farm, prompting Shaun to devise a plan to outwit the thieving bird

programme.desc: The crimebusting rodent heads to ancient Greece where he becomes fast friends with Zeus, who bestows godly powers upon him

programme.desc: When Adeline quits due to artistic differences, Cheese is hired as director of the annual town founders' play. The family is happy to help, but Cheese soon turns super-bossy!

programme.desc: Topical news magazine for children.

programme.desc: Even for a giant seven foot bear, it's not easy getting rid of pesky lemmings but it's all fun seeing them constantly try to outsmart each other with cheeky plans

programme.desc: Strange things begin happening to a basketball team, so Olive and Otto make use of the number skills to investigate

programme.desc: Wildlife expert Steve Backshall turns detective to solve CBBC viewers' animal mysteries. From sharks to squid, Steve answers questions about marine animals

programme.title: Monster Loving Maniacs
programme.desc: In a quest for unimaginable pampering, Phil joins forces with an ancient mummy.

programme.title: Transformers EarthSpark
programme.desc: The Terrans erratic behaviour is affecting Mo and Robbys first day of school.

programme.title: Nova Jones
programme.desc: Fashionably late Nova has to work with difficult designer to make a new dress

programme.title: Game on Grandparents
programme.desc: Aston and Teresa go head to head with Alfie and Nigel as they compete for the chance to make it to the Grand Final and become ultimate Game on Grandparents champion.

programme.title: Class Dismissed
programme.desc: Mr Christopher searches for talent in his quest to find Dockbridge High's next top teaching assistant, and Hilary Head has to face her greatest fear - children. Narrated by Bill Turnbull

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors find out what to do if someone has a broken leg, and Dr Chris meets someone with a bionic eye. Meanwhile, in Accident & Emergency, a patient has been injured performing handstands, and another has a badly broken arm

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome little ones Alfie, Charlie, Ollie, River, Araiya and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their babies at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Inside Giovannas bag are numbered building blocks, and all the parents and little ones have different objects and toys that are themed around numbers. These are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding safe, baby-appropriate number-themed objects and toys inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The traditional childrens nursery rhyme One, Two, Buckle My Shoe features, as does a story involving Baby Bear, and viewers at home show how theyve been exploring numbers too. The Action Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory bubbles and the Goodbye Song.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Sebastiaan's making a South African bobotie, which is a local dish his family have shared with him. He starts by putting chopped spring onions, grated courgette, turmeric powder, ground coriander and torn red pepper into a casserole dish and cooking them. He then adds garlic puree, ginger puree, chutney and chopped tomatoes to cooked beef mince. Sebastiaan then carefully makes powder out of his special ingredient, cumin seeds, and adds the powder to the beef mixture. Sebastiaan mixes both the vegetables and the beef in an oven dish and flattens them before adding two bay leaves. He adds a topping of milk and egg and then places it in the oven. Sebastiaan has a wonderfully decorated table, and he has another traditional treat to go with his bobotie. Will his friends figure out what his special ingredient is?

programme.desc: Holly comes from the English city, Liverpool. She will be making two tasty recipes. She then takes her special ingredient of saffron, grinds it down to a powder, and adds salt and natural yoghurt before she mixes it in with the rest of the marinade. Suri serves her chicken joojeh with tomatoes. They enjoy the meal while sitting on the floor, a traditional Iranian custom on special occasions. Will her friends like the special ingredient when it is cooked in her joojeh?

Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny does better than he does, and Love Monster feels jealous of the attention that she gets. He becomes so frustrated that he kicks a beanbag and it hurtles towards the scoreboard, knocking all the points to the ground, ripping the bunting and giving Delivery Duckling, Elder Chick, Elder Panda and the In-Chicks a fright. The crowd is stunned into silence. Love Monster is horrified at what he has done and immediately says sorry. He explains that he wants everyone to cheer for him like they cheer for Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. She admits it did feel good and tingly inside when everyone was cheering for her, but she says that everyone has something they are good at and Love Monster is the best beatboxer in Fluffytown. Love Monster realises that she is right and starts beatboxing. The Fluffytowners start having fun again and begin cheering for him.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Glitch turns the canals of Venice into roads

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The team goes where no Go Jetter has gone before, when Glitch tries to launch into space by attaching huge rocket boosters to Grim HQ

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: Dog finds the original book that starts all of his adventures. He shows Pug how he started the bookshop and how he read all the books, so he could recommend which books each customer should read. It was a great success but Pug was not in this story.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, its Lemon with his laugh-out-loud stand-up act about all things green (and yellow).

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin goes ice skating with his friends and Mr Tumble builds a cosy den in his bedroom

programme.title: Get Well Soon
programme.desc: Riz cuts his arms so Dr Ranj puts on a plaster, and Nurse Morag explains to the helpers why scabs are amazing

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee and the Squirrels are out doing a bit of sailing. When Tag starts to feel a little bit seasick, Duggee suggests a stop off at the Island for a spot of lunch, but finds the picnic basket is empty. Everything is still on board and the boat is drifting out to sea, but thanks to Duggee having his Island Badge - he knows what to do

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels have had an exhausting morning playing. After their milk they can have their nap. However, Tag cannot sleep, so Duggee tries to help with his Sleeping Badge. He tells Tag about how other animals sleep and a few tricks they use to manage it

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: The letters introduce Y and Z, and the words zap, yak, yap, yell, jazz and zigzag

programme.title: Pfffirates
programme.desc: When an island magically appears in the Korsairs' path, they stop off to explore it

programme.title: What's in Your Bag?
programme.desc: Astronomer Carole tells us how her amazing astronomy binoculars help her to see stars and planets in the night sky

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran visit the wetland centre to go pond dipping with Cynthia. JoJo wants to see a dragonfly. She spots many pond creatures like diving beetles and mayfly nymphs. Just when JoJo thinks she might not see a dragonfly, one appears! JoJo learns that the pond is home to lots of creatures

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea steals Tomato's precious jewel and Supertato tries to get it back

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea pretends to help Supertato and Carrot train for crime prevention, but she tricks them and steals a mobile phone

programme.title: Nick Cope's Popcast
programme.desc: Nick and Norman are stuck up a tree and Nick discovers the secret of Grandpa's old guitar

programme.title: Nick Cope's Popcast
programme.desc: Nick bakes Grandma a cake, but it goes wrong. The Popcasters tell him to keep on trying

programme.title: Magic Hands
programme.desc: The Little Big Man and Clouds and Waves both by Rabindranath Tagore. Look at what my hands can do! Some tiny shoes and a silken shirt take Donna, Simon and the Magic Hands creature crew on an adventure back in time. Simon goes to Bengal where he meets a little boy who dearly wants to be a grown up, while Donna meets a little girl and her Mummy, played by Bobbles the Bear, who live by the sea and imagine playing with magical people who live in the clouds and the waves

programme.title: Treasure Champs
programme.desc: Kari is fascinated by how a pinwheel moves in the wind - can she make one of her own?

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea freezes the Veggies so she can take over the whole supermarket

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo is desperate to show off her handstand skills

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun tries to rescue gluttonous goat Mowermouth before being harvested along with the maize

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar meet one of the zoos noisiest residents, Arthur the sea lion. He shows them his amazing teeth and flippers and then jumps in the water to demonstrate his incredible swimming skills. Next, they visit the biggest rodent in the world, the capybara. Steve and Aneeshwar give them their breakfast and reveal the wild connection between these two very different animals

programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: Down at the harbour one day, Fred and Pete are happily recording some of the sounds of Cornwall when they hear something amazing, the like of which they've never heard before. They decide to take the recording to Suzy and Archie at the museum. Archies clue says that the song is related to the sea, so Suzy sends them to meet some singers who know all about sailors and their songs. Its back to the harbour for Fred and Pete. Once there, they meet singing group Figurehead. The ladies explain that the song theyre singing is a sea shanty sung by sailors on board ships. Suzy calls up on the Treasure Comm and sends them off to a nearby ship in the harbour to learn more about why sailors sang shanties. Now they know what sea shanties are for, Fred and Pete decide to test out their sailing skills on their very own vessel. But even on a small boat, the hapless duo get in each others way. They decide that the only way to sort things out is to write their very own sea shanty! Finally, Fred and

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Evie's teacher comes for a home visit and the Brooklyn-Bells want Waffle to be on his best behaviour, but Waffle cannot stop chewing everything

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: Animated series about an almost five year-old girl and her fun and wise grandmother who always has something planned to do when JoJo comes to visit.

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: Rainbow's colourful glow inspires an art project

programme.title: Charlie and Lola
programme.desc: Charlie helps his sister Lola read her new storybook, in the hope of reducing the pressure she is experiencing at school keeping up with the other pupils

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Mo is upset when Tee accidentally breaks her favourite perfume

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Tiny Clanger finds out that she is going to receive a surprise, but is mystified as to what it might be and even more puzzled that no one will tell her

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy sings with a megaphone in the garden, and wants to carry on instead of going to bed or playing with Igglepiggle. Narrated by Derek Jacobi

programme.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: Mark ROnson reads the story Rhyme Crime by Jon Burgerman

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In London, emergency responders remember the nightmare they faced during the Westminster Bridge terror attack. In Staffordshire, a newly taser trained PC must decide whether to fire her taser for the first time - at a woman wielding two machetes

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: How a UK fibre specialist brought closure to Australia's longest-running murder investigation. Plus, the forensic pharmacologist who used her expertise to ensure a murder charge after two brutal killings. Presented by Ashley John-Baptiste

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell is in Shirley in the West Midlands to see a two-bed mid-terrace, bought to be a first-time home. She's also in Darlington, Co Durham, to meet an experienced developer with plans to bring a tired two bed terrace back to life. Tommy Walsh heads to Romford, Essex, to see a three-bed semi in need of some serious renovation

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Stephanie Connell and Raj Bisram help two teams look for items at Bath Racecourse, while presenter Eric Knowles look at Chinese ceramics with an eye-watering price tag

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore searches for unrealised gems among the junk at Wallyford Recycling Centre in East Lothian. She enlists the help of upholsterer Leigh-Anne Treadwell to work on an unloved armchair, while bag-maker Neil Wragg sets to work on a golf trolley and wooden box. Sarah herself has a Victorian trunk to revitalise. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef glimpses life in Cornwall 2,000 years ago as he explores the atmospheric ruins of the ancient village of Carn Euny. Rick also cooks his favourite Sunday lunch, a hearty steak and kidney pudding, and goes for a bracing ride on a beautiful hand-built boat

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton travels to the Warwickshire countryside to help a couple with a 600,000 budget finds a rural home for them and their two young daughters. While in the region, Alistair visits one of the country's last surviving water mills still running commercially and meets a miller harnessing the natural power of the River Avon to produce his flour

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Will Kirk is entrusted with the restoration of a cherished family crib, Dominic Chinea hopes to rejuvenate a rusted pogo stick that's lost its spring, while Chris Shaw attempts to reassemble the pages of a dilapidated cookbook. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win 5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Stephen Mangan

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live chat and topical reports, presented by Alex Jones and Roman Kemp

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Bobby tries to make amends with Anna but she asks that they stay friends. George breaks down as he orders Cindy and the rest of the Beales to leave the Square but they instead take refuge at Alfie's

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals continue, with the candidates joined by rapper, grime MC, songwriter and DJ Big Zuu. They are tasked to recreate one of his favourite recipes - getting to appreciate that food that is very personal to him. The celebrities need to deliver on the techniques, flavours and love that go into these dishes in order to impress Big Zuu and judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. The celebrity who outshines the rest will earn a pass straight through to the next round. The remaining six must cook off and make a plate of food that evokes a special time and place in their lives

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: It's a busy start to the shift, as North West Ambulance Service senior paramedic Aiden is dispatched to a category two patient who has fallen 20ft from a tree with an open wrist fracture. As Aiden treats the person, another job comes in for a two-year-old who has fallen from a balcony. Crewmates Jodie and Tom attend to a male patient who has been vomiting blood and is in need of urgent medical attention at Salford Royal. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: The team re-examines the case of Suzanne Greenhill, a 20-year-old deaf woman from Newport. In 1988 Suzanne was found murdered at home, her body ghoulishly staged to represent the cover of an Iron Maiden heavy metal album cover. Detectives had to work closely with the deaf community to uncover the identity of Suzanne's killer, with pioneering forensic techniques called upon to secure a conviction. It has gone down in history as one of the most unique murder investigations in policing history

programme.title: Green Book (2018)
programme.desc: In the 1960s, working-class Italian-American bouncer Tony Lip becomes the driver of Dr Donald Shirley, an African-American classical pianist on a tour of venues through the American South. Director Peter Farrelly's Bafta and Oscar-winning comedy drama, starring Viggo Mortensen, Mahershala Ali and Linda Cardellini

programme.desc: In Staffordshire, two officers save the life of a man in a burning building. In Avon and Somerset, officers tackle county lines drug-dealing, and in Norfolk two firearms officers come face to face with a gunman in a car park

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: When a teenager's body is located in a shallow grave, a soil specialist is called on to unearth evidence to convict the killer. Plus, as a Merseyside murder investigation stalls, a fibre expert is enlisted to revive the case. Presented by Ashley John-Baptiste

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin, Jacqui Joseph and Tommy Walsh follow the progress of a Victorian terrace in Aylesbury, a fire-damaged house in Bolton and four barns in the village of St Mary in the Marsh, Kent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The teams search for antiques in Exeter, taking on board expert advice provided by Richard Madley and Ben Cooper. Christina Trevanion presents, and also travels to the south-west coast to learn about the history of the sea shanty

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Five Bedrooms
programme.desc: Harry almost pulls off the celebration of a lifetime at Manju's 70th, until Ainsley accidentally reveals last year's secret baby negotiations, causing Manju to promptly declare war on her son. Return of the Australian comedy drama, starring Roy Joseph

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef witnesses a fishing method frozen in time, where the use of engines and winches is banned, and goes fishing under sail for what he considers to be the best oysters in the world. Back on dry land, Rick cooks a warming fish soup called Cullen Skink, and discovers the all-but-forgotten story of Cornwall's ancient capital, Lostwithiel

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes house hunting with couple who have a healthy 900,000 budget and want to start a new life closer to loved ones in the Worcestershire countryside. Jonnie also visits brine springs at Droitwich Spa to meet a family breathing new life into the region's salt heritage for the first time in a century

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Amanda Tatchell and Julie Middleditch join forces with David Burville to get a treasured baby doll back to its beautiful best by addressing her cracked face and crumbling hands and feet. A worn-out suitcase dating from the Second World War and a seized-up silver locket are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win 5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with another mix of live chat and topical reports

programme.title: Kiri's TV Flashback
programme.desc: Comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean looks for some amusing clips in the BBC Wales archive that illustrate the things - big and small - that the Welsh like to spend their money on

programme.title: Wynne Evans: For One Night Only
programme.desc: First shown in March, the singer, radio presenter and comedy performer celebrates St David's Day with a show full of music and laughter at St David's Hall. He bases the evening around a light-hearted telling of his life story, from his beginnings in Carmarthenshire to a career on the opera stages of the world, and now TV and radio fame. He punctuates his tale with comedy routines and a selection of songs that soundtrack his journey and illustrate his love of music. He is joined by his brother and fellow singer Mark, plus West End star Sophie Evans

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The last of the semi-final contests sees the celebrities asked to cook the ultimate airline food to celebrate the golden age of travel. Each must create a main course, a side dish and a dessert that will be served in first class style. The celebrities' meal is key to staying on course for the ultimate stage of the competition as at the end of this edition, only the five best cooks will go through to Finals Week. Presented by Gregg Wallace and John Torode

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: It's the big day for Kath and Diane as they attempt to finally exact their revenge on Martin. However, while Diane has never felt more alive, Kath seems to be having second thoughts. Comedy, written by and starring Sian Gibson, with Rosie Cavaliero, Conleth Hill, Sheila Reid and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rewind: 60 Years of Welsh Pop
programme.desc: Performances from the 1990s, including Manic Street Preachers, Tigertailz, Charlotte Church, Super Furry Animals, Donna Lewis, Feeder, and Welsh music veteran Tom Jones

programme.title: Starstruck
programme.desc: Years after their break-up, Jessie and Tom come face to face unexpectedly at best friend Kate's wedding as she ties the knot with Ian. The initially awkward meeting finds the two former lovers wondering if there is a lingering spark. Comedy, written by and starring Rose Matafeo

programme.title: Starstruck
programme.desc: Tom's engagement party with new partner and fellow actor Clem puts pressure on Kate as she has to decide where her loyalties lie. Meanwhile, Jessie distracts herself using a date with Liam and the pair bond at the bowling alley but their evening is cut short as they rush off to help Joe with a flat pack furniture emergency. Rose Matafeo stars

programme.title: The Mule (2018)
programme.desc: Earl Stone, an award-winning horticulturist and Korean War veteran, is facing financial ruin. The Illinois octogenarian is estranged from his ex-wife Mary and daughter Iris for always putting work before family. In an attempt to put things right, he becomes a courier for a Mexican cartel. Drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood, with Bradley Cooper and Laurence Fishburne

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Julie Lin and Philip Khoury, plus special guest Scott Mills. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond and chef Nick Nairn focus on Scottish seasonal vegetables, cooking a spiced roast root vegetable curry with handmade chapatis. Joining them in the kitchen are cookery teacher Sumayya Usmani, who specialises in vegetarian dishes, and food-and-drink journalist Rosalind Erskine, who's brought along a drink made from Scottish potatoes

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Arsenal v Manchester United. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Sheffield United and Everton

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and David Harper help two teams find potentially profitable items at the East of England showground in Peterborough, while presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp attempts to get to the bottom of an ancient mystery

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Anton Du Beke, Katya Jones and Graziano Di Prima join Nick Knowles and the team in Wallsend, Newcastle. Together, they set to work transforming the True Colours performing arts school, an inclusive dance school that teaches dance and theatre skills to 500 children and young adults weekly, many of whom have disabilities and learning needs. The school has grown substantially over time and they've completely outgrown their existing space, so the team get to work renovating a run-down old boys club that would give the dance school the extra space it so desperately needs to continue to transform more young lives

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway walks the Dee Valley Way, a stunning 13-mile route which takes him from the pretty town of Corwen to its larger and more bustling neighbour, Llangollen. On his trek, he learns about a warrior prince, re-opens a pub and leads a horse-drawn barge along the Llangollen Canal. Wildlife expert Lizzie Daly also sees how a re-homed family of beavers is settling in and Matt Bassett crosses the jaw dropping Pontcysyllte Aqueduct in a specially adapted canoe

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Stephen Greer has served many years in jail for drugs, firearm and paramilitary offences. During his last sentence he started taking art classes - and found it changed his life. Stephen returns to HM Prison Magilligan for the first time since his release to trial a new pilot scheme teaching art to prisoners. His hope is that art will transform the current offenders' lives as it did his. Contributors include a man serving two years for criminal damage, assault and breaching a restraining order and another, who is serving five years for actual bodily harm, grievous bodily harm and assault

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: England and rugby union player Jonny Hill, Olympic Gold medal winning swimmer Freya Anderson, world champion gymnast Joe Fraser and former Everton midfielder Leon Osman join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: Truckers: Life on the Road
programme.desc: Documentary following the team at one of the biggest haulage companies in Wales. Trigger's one of a small number of female longdistance HGV drivers. Today, she's due to be taking a delivery from Newport up to Manchester - though a catalogue of disasters mean she's struggling to get out of the starting block. Van driver Gary's got no time to waste as he navigates his way round the streets of Llanelli delivering 120 parcels. Elsewhere, veteran driver Phil aka 'The Donk' gives recently recruited receptionist Jess a crash-course in all things trucking - quite literally - with a day out to the Pembrey Truck Races

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present the music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a 10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show off their music knowledge are siblings Mairi and Alastair from Glasgow, mother and daughter Angela and Riziki from Brighton, and couple Mina and Paul from Birmingham and London

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts a food and drink special in which John Whaite, Rustie Lee, Chris Bavin, Peter Sawkins, Jane Dunn from Jane's Patisserie, Nick Nairn, Poppy O'Toole and Romy Gill try to win 50,000 for charity

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Jim Rosenthal, Tom Rosenthal, Sonnaz Nooranvary, Brenton West, Kadeena Cox, Lauren Steadman, Mark Wingett and Trudie Goodwin try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max's health fails him but he remains in denial, whilst Faith's lies unravel and Teddy seeks advice from Gethin

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Stevie keeps a close eye on Faith as she implodes, Jodie has an unexpected reunion, much to Max's dismay, and Teddy makes an impulsive decision

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Fulham at Craven Cottage and Brighton & Hove Albion v Newcastle United at Amex Stadium. Champions City prevailed 2-1 against Fulham in last season's corresponding fixture despite Joao Cancelo's 26th-minute sending off. Brighton and Newcastle both impressed last term and could not be separated when the teams met here. Plus, Sheffield United v Everton, Brentford v Bournemouth, Burnley v Tottenham Hotspur, Chelsea v Nottingham Forest and Luton Town v West Ham United

programme.title: The Company You Keep (2012)
programme.desc: A respected lawyer is forced to go on the run when a reporter exposes the truth about him - he is really a member of a radical militant group wanted for questioning in a murder case, who has been living under a fake identity for 30 years. As the fugitive goes in search of his old allies for sanctuary, the reporter delves into his past and uncovers disturbing secrets. Thriller based on the novel by Neil Gordon, directed by and starring Robert Redford, with Shia LaBeouf, Julie Christie and Susan Sarandon

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win 5,000. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with another mix of live chat and topical reports

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Stephen Greer has served many years in jail for drugs, firearm and paramilitary offences. During his last sentence he started taking art classes - and found it changed his life. Stephen returns to HM Prison Magilligan for the first time since his release to trial a new pilot scheme teaching art to prisoners. His hope is that art will transform the current offenders' lives as it did his. Contributors include a man serving two years for criminal damage, assault and breaching a restraining order and another, who is serving five years for actual bodily harm, grievous bodily harm and assault

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: England and rugby union player Jonny Hill, Olympic Gold medal winning swimmer Freya Anderson, world champion gymnast Joe Fraser and former Everton midfielder Leon Osman join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack welcome Angellica Bell, Bob Mortimer, Suggs and Holly Willoughby to the comedy panel show on which the teams reveal extraordinary stories about themselves. But are they telling the truth, or are they making it all up?

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The last of the semi-final contests sees the celebrities asked to cook the ultimate airline food to celebrate the golden age of travel. Each must create a main course, a side dish and a dessert that will be served in first class style. The celebrities' meal is key to staying on course for the ultimate stage of the competition as at the end of this edition, only the five best cooks will go through to Finals Week. Presented by Gregg Wallace and John Torode

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: It's the big day for Kath and Diane as they attempt to finally exact their revenge on Martin. However, while Diane has never felt more alive, Kath seems to be having second thoughts. Comedy, written by and starring Sian Gibson, with Rosie Cavaliero, Conleth Hill, Sheila Reid and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Starstruck
programme.desc: Years after their break-up, Jessie and Tom come face to face unexpectedly at best friend Kate's wedding as she ties the knot with Ian. The initially awkward meeting finds the two former lovers wondering if there is a lingering spark. Comedy, written by and starring Rose Matafeo

programme.title: Starstruck
programme.desc: Tom's engagement party with new partner and fellow actor Clem puts pressure on Kate as she has to decide where her loyalties lie. Meanwhile, Jessie distracts herself using a date with Liam and the pair bond at the bowling alley but their evening is cut short as they rush off to help Joe with a flat pack furniture emergency. Rose Matafeo stars

programme.title: Kyle Falconer: Love & Chaos
programme.desc: Documentary about View frontman Kyle Falconer and his fiance Laura Wilde's relationship, exploring how the extreme highs and lows they have faced together have shaped them as a couple. As Kyle and Laura prepare to bring their new stage show on postnatal depression to the Edinburgh Fringe, this documentary gives a front row seat to the drama of their lives as it unfolds

programme.title: The Mule (2018)
programme.desc: Earl Stone, an award-winning horticulturist and Korean War veteran, is facing financial ruin. The Illinois octogenarian is estranged from his ex-wife Mary and daughter Iris for always putting work before family. In an attempt to put things right, he becomes a courier for a Mexican cartel. Drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood, with Bradley Cooper and Laurence Fishburne

programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Anton Du Beke, Katya Jones and Graziano Di Prima join Nick Knowles and the team in Wallsend, Newcastle. Together, they set to work transforming the True Colours performing arts school, an inclusive dance school that teaches dance and theatre skills to 500 children and young adults weekly, many of whom have disabilities and learning needs. The school has grown substantially over time and they've completely outgrown their existing space, so the team get to work renovating a run-down old boys club that would give the dance school the extra space it so desperately needs to continue to transform more young lives

programme.title: Casualty

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Fulham at Craven Cottage and Brighton & Hove Albion v Newcastle United at Amex Stadium. Champions City prevailed 2-1 against Fulham in last season's corresponding fixture despite Joao Cancelo's 26th-minute sending off. Brighton and Newcastle both impressed last term and could not be separated when the teams met here. Plus, Sheffield United v Everton, Brentford v Bournemouth, Burnley v Tottenham Hotspur, Chelsea v Nottingham Forest and Luton Town v West Ham United

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, featuring Kilmarnock v Ross County at BBSP Stadium Rugby Park, Livingston v St Mirren at Tony Macaroni Arena and St Johnstone v Dundee at McDiarmid Park

programme.title: The Company You Keep (2012)
programme.desc: A respected lawyer is forced to go on the run when a reporter exposes the truth about him - he is really a member of a radical militant group wanted for questioning in a murder case, who has been living under a fake identity for 30 years. As the fugitive goes in search of his old allies for sanctuary, the reporter delves into his past and uncovers disturbing secrets. Thriller based on the novel by Neil Gordon, directed by and starring Robert Redford, with Shia LaBeouf, Julie Christie and Susan Sarandon

programme.title: Expert Witness

programme.desc: Martel Maxwell is in Shirley in the West Midlands to see a two-bed mid-terrace, bought to be a first-time home. programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton travels to the Warwickshire countryside to help a couple with a 600,000 budget finds a rural home for them and their two young daughters. programme.title: Patrick Kielty's Tractor Wars: Ferguson vs Ford
programme.desc: The presenter explores the untold story of Harry Ferguson and Henry Ford's remarkable handshake agreement, and how it led to a $250million lawsuit. In 1938, Ferguson and Ford - two former farm boys - shook hands on a 'gentleman's agreement' with the ambition to change the agricultural world for ever. Henry Ford, founder of the Ford Motor Company, and Harry Ferguson, the Ulster inventor, agreed to mass-produce an ingenious new tractor. Together they hoped to mechanise the world of the struggling small farmer on an industrial scale, and put an end to the depressed 1930s

programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers welcomes Yorkshireman Ged, who has brought in a classic piece of industrial furniture saved from the scrap heap. Henrie wants to sell a silver and mahogany Chinese inkwell from the early 19th century. And Molly from Manchester is selling a a watchman's timepiece

Competing to show off their music knowledge are siblings Mairi and Alastair from Glasgow, mother and daughter Angela and Riziki from Brighton, and couple Mina and Paul from Birmingham and London

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts a food and drink special in which John Whaite, Rustie Lee, Chris Bavin, Peter Sawkins, Jane Dunn from Jane's Patisserie, Nick Nairn, Poppy O'Toole and Romy Gill try to win 50,000 for charity

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Fulham at Craven Cottage and Brighton & Hove Albion v Newcastle United at Amex Stadium. Champions City prevailed 2-1 against Fulham in last season's corresponding fixture despite Joao Cancelo's 26th-minute sending off. Brighton and Newcastle both impressed last term and could not be separated when the teams met here. Plus, Sheffield United v Everton, Brentford v Bournemouth, Burnley v Tottenham Hotspur, Chelsea v Nottingham Forest and Luton Town v West Ham United

programme.title: The Company You Keep (2012)
programme.desc: A respected lawyer is forced to go on the run when a reporter exposes the truth about him - he is really a member of a radical militant group wanted for questioning in a murder case, who has been living under a fake identity for 30 years. As the fugitive goes in search of his old allies for sanctuary, the reporter delves into his past and uncovers disturbing secrets. Thriller based on the novel by Neil Gordon, directed by and starring Robert Redford, with Shia LaBeouf, Julie Christie and Susan Sarandon

programme.desc: Often considered as the beating heart of the Earth, the trees in the Amazon absorb water from the ground and pump out billion of tons of water vapour a day into vast 'flying rivers', essential to the environmental balance. But what if this natural phenomenon was to disappear? What would be the ecological consequences on our planet? From the Amazon rainforest to some of the world's top laboratories and research centres, and thanks to 3D animation sequences, this scientific investigation deciphers the mechanisms of this extraordinary phenomenon

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Spy (2015)

Comedy adventure, starring Melissa McCarthy, Jason Statham and Rose Byrne

programme.title: Katie Piper's Breakfast Show
programme.desc: Katie returns for another Sunday packed with wonderful guests and inspiring experts, with comedian Laura Smyth and Emmerdale star Amy Walsh joining her in the studio

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team heads to the Yorkshire Dales to surprise Jim Thompson, a terminally ill 65-year-old grandfather and fundraiser. Despite Jim's own diagnosis, his commitment to spreading awareness and raising money for prostate cancer charities are legendary in the area, including creating a 'Calendar Girls' style naked calendar. Inspired by his bravery and dedication, the makeover team decide to turn Jim's overgrown and dangerous plot into a classic cottage garden with a Yorkshire twist

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Tamzin Outhwaite discusses stepping back to the 1960s for drama Ridley Road,and former EastEnders star Annette Badland talks about keeping the men in check in Midsome. Plus, the competitive sport of duck herding

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Oti Mabuse's Breakfast Show
programme.desc: The Dancing on Ice judge and former Strictly Come Dancing professional is joined by comedian Kae Kurd and actress Hayley Tamaddon

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James serves up delicious food for Loose Women star Charlene White and there are recipes from chefs Claude Bosi, Chantelle Nicholson and Nick Nairn

programme.title: Jason Atherton's Dubai Dishes
programme.desc: Jason celebrates Dubai-style quick bites and food on the go, showcasing oysters with a spicy Asian inspired dressing, and grilled corn with chilli and parmesan. He is joined by Hattem Mattar, who cooks macaroni cheese with spicy lamb sausages over an open wood fire

programme.title: Ainsley's Good Mood Food
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott focuses on recipes involving nuts and seeds, including chocolate and ginger florentines, and makes dukkah-crusted rack of lamb on the barbecue, served with smoked aubergine and warm carrot salad

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Chester for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard asks the questions as Tony Blackburn, Tim Vine and Megan McKenna answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: Death Becomes Her (1992)
programme.desc: Two romantic rivals are both granted the secret of eternal youth by a mysterious mystic. However, as they battle to get their claws into a plastic surgeon, they discover their now-immortal bodies are capable of taking whatever damage they can dish out. Black comedy fantasy, starring Goldie Hawn, Meryl Streep, Bruce Willis and Isabella Rossellini

programme.title: Johnny English (2003)
programme.desc: A bumbling secret agent becomes Britain's leading spy following the assassination of all the country's other espionage experts. Single-handedly he sets out to unmask a mysterious villain responsible for stealing the Crown Jewels - but no one is prepared to believe a sinister billionaire is the culprit. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, John Malkovich, Natalie Imbruglia and Ben Miller

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as Lance Ellington, Beth Tweddle, Bob Champion and Sally Lindsay pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Spectre (2015)
programme.desc: James Bond goes rogue after receiving a cryptic message that sets him on the trail of a secretive criminal network. While his colleagues face a new threat closer to home, 007 embarks on a globetrotting journey in search of the elusive mastermind behind the syndicate - whom he discovers may have links to his own past and had involvement in previous events during some of Bond's most dangerous missions. Spy thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Christoph Waltz, Lea Seydoux, Ben Whishaw and Ralph Fiennes

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Leeds United v Sheffield Wednesday at Elland Road, Leicester City v Hull City at King Power Stadium and Sunderland v Southampton at Stadium of Light in the Championship

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: All In
programme.desc: A chance to see the wrestling company's biggest ever show at Wembley Stadium, where MJF v Adam Cole for the AEW World Championship was the scheduled main event after they had earlier been due to team up with each other to challenge Aussie Open for the ROH World Tag Team Championship. Other scheduled matches included Darby Allin and Sting v Mogul Embassy, FTR v The Young Bucks for the AEW World Tag Team Championship and a four-way match for the AEW Women's World Championship
