programme.desc: Lord Ashfordly's niece comes to stay in Aidensfield following the breakdown of her marriage, but immediately suffers another blow when her prize racehorse is kidnapped and held to ransom. Rural drama, starring Vanessa Hehir and Lauren Drummond

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Doc Martin

It confirms she is showing early signs of dementia. Meanwhile, Louisa plans a special evening to celebrate Martin's birthday, and Al decides to throw Morwenna a surprise engagement party on the same night. There are also problems when Louisa's class tutorial ends in disaster. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz and Eileen Atkins

programme.desc: John returns to England to declare he is suffering from amnesia, where he is reunited with his sons. Journalists hunt down Anne in Panama and the story starts to unravel as a photograph of the two of them emerges. Starring Eddie Marsan and Monica Dolan

programme.title: The Thief, His Wife and the Canoe
programme.desc: The truth emerges as Anne and John are interviewed by the police, and the case goes to trial where Anne pleads not guilty on the grounds of marital coercion. Their traumatised sons initially refuse contact, but come to find forgiveness for their mother. Starring Eddie Marsan and Monica Dolan

programme.desc: Stephen gets a drenching during a moonlit walk with Jacqui and an abandoned baby opens old wounds for Ruth. Elsewhere, Vic helps Sandra in her hour of need while Peggy is away on her Italian course. Family drama, starring Sarah Lancashire and Tony Haygarth

Drama, starring Sarah Lancashire

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered amateur detectives work on a garden for an open-air theatre, where Rosemary's cousin is due to perform. However, as the pair look into the case, they find themselves drawn into a competitive world of blackmail, bribery and bloodshed, where winning comes at any cost

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.desc: In a bid to outdo Marie's culinary skills, Debra goes against tradition by serving a fish dish on Thanksgiving. Not to be upstaged, her meddling mother-in-law turns up with a turkey. Comedy, starring Patricia Heaton

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: After spending weeks nursing an injured pigeon back to health, Bart is left distraught when Santa's Little Helper eats his feathered friend. Things go from bad to worse for the mischievous greyhound when a psychiatrist recommends the family finds the dog a new home. Featuring the guest voice of Rachel Weisz

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Four tales celebrating the festive season. Bart hatches a plan to hold Santa Claus hostage, while in a 1940s-set story, Lisa refuses to give in to the holiday spirit until her mother returns home safe from the Battle of the Bulge. Home improvement expert Martha Stewart helps a desperate Marge, and Katy Perry leads the family in a rendition of The 39 Days of Christmas

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is persuaded to go undercover to win the trust of Fat Tony as part of an FBI operation to bring the mobster down after an incident involving recycling responsibilities and bribery. With the voice of Jon Hamm (Mad Men)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer becomes obsessed with a father-son relationship in a 1980s sitcom, using it as a source of inspiration to deal with Bart's hankering for a must-have mini-bike. However, when the youngster starts trading nuclear secrets with the Chinese government, Homer must find a new way to bring his son into line

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart becomes convinced Milhouse and Martin are trying to steal a valuable comic book they all clubbed together to buy. As his paranoia escalates, the three enter into a dangerous confrontation that threatens to end their friendship. With the guest voice of Daniel Stern

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge is left feeling jealous and dejected by an encounter with old school friend Chloe (guest star Kim Cattrall), who has found fame, fortune and success as a high-flying investigative journalist

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A hillbilly's tirade about Springfield prompts Mayor Quimby to legalise same-sex marriage in the town. Homer sees the opportunity to cash in by getting ordained over the internet and conducting weddings himself. As scores of people come out of the closet, Marge's sister Patty makes a shock announcement

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Milhouse falls in love with a new girl at school and begins to spend all his time with her, so, in a bid to get his friend back, Bart decides to tell her strict Catholic father about the relationship

programme.title: Jamie's 1 Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver presents recipes that keep costs under control in the kitchen. In the first episode, he shares a roast chicken recipe that saves both time and money by filling chicken thighs with a super-simple stuffing to make the meat stretch further. Plus, a pancake batter-based dish with layers of spinach, ham and cheese and a pizza that doesn't even need you to turn on the oven

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Clergyman Ken is planning a permanent move to the district of Larnaca in Cyprus, and he's asked his good friend Katie to help him with the search. He's been visiting friends in Cyprus for years and, now that he's retired from his role as a prison chaplain, he thinks it's the perfect time to move closer to them. With a budget of 80,000, Jasmine Harman is tasked with finding him the perfect place. She has five properties up her sleeve but will any of them be the answer to Father Ken's prayers?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Manigeh and Ian from Edinburgh met 12 years ago and between them have 10 grown-up children and four grandchildren. They want to buy their first property together and since they both love the Spanish lifestyle and the buzz of a busy town, they've chosen the seaside town of Torrevieja to base their search. Jean Johansson lines up five suitable options for their budget of 90,000

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first destination is North Kingsfield Holiday Cottages in East Yorkshire, where a revelation over evening drinks leaves the guests all at sea

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Crackin' View Guest House in Northumberland. Owners Steve and Maria Turnbull reckon their scenic vista and homespun appeal will pip their rivals to the post

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals arrive at the Domo Boutique Hotel in Oldbury near Birmingham, where owner Ali expects his luxury lodgings to wow his fellow competitors. Helen and Lauren are dazzled by the decor, but a caffeine conundrum leads to some trouble brewing

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guest house owners convene at the Crown Inn in Gayton, Norfolk, where owners Lisa and Neil Staples hope their historic setting and boutique-style rooms will garner praise. Once they've checked in, Helen and Lauren make a critical observation about the cleanliness of the windows, while Ali and Serge are left feeling exposed in the bathroom. On a buggy ride across a wildlife reserve, the rivalry spills over into some raucous racing - but at drinks, it's Neil's chat-up lines that veer off track

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts meet one last time to settle scores and discover what they've been paid. First up is Helen Milner, and her daughter Lauren, but although they asked one pair to close off their curtain comments, it's a surprising set of payments which leave them open-mouthed. Another host addresses why his guests weren't full of beans - only for one pair to express some strong opinions about his breakfast. Off-colour feedback about one B&B's bedding leads to more frank exchanges. The guests' dramatic discoveries surface, before the payments are revealed and the winner is finally announced

programme.title: Matt Baker's Travels in the Country: USA
programme.desc: Matt gets a rare up-close encounter with some gigantic elephant seals on California's Pacific coast and meets a flower farmer in the hills of Rainbow who has managed to perfect growing beautiful blooms on the steep slopes. Up in Pioneertown, the presenter meets the residents of a real life wild-west town that was originally created for the movies before hiking out in the Santa Rosa mountains. Finally, he stops in Santa Cruz to find out why the coast became the birthplace of surfing in mainland USA

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Action from the battle for pole position in the 15th round of the season, held at Autodromo Nazionale di Monza. Charles Leclerc of Ferrari qualified fastest here last year, with Max Verstappen of Red Bull joining him at the front of the grid. Lee McKenzie presents, with analysis from David Coulthard, Alice Powell and Ariana Bravo

programme.title: Taken (2008)
programme.desc: An American teenager travelling through Europe is abducted by a gang of sex traffickers. However, what the kidnappers do not realise is that the girl's father is a former CIA agent, who employs all his old skills as he searches for the criminals and tries to rescue his daughter. Thriller, starring Liam Neeson, Famke Janssen and Maggie Grace

programme.title: Assassin's Creed (2016)
programme.desc: A convict facing execution is recruited for a secret experiment where his consciousness is sent back in time to experience the life of his ancestor - a 15th-century ancestor battling a secret society. With the same evil organisation plotting world domination in the present, he must master his predecessor's skills and unlock his secret knowledge to defeat them. Action adventure based on the video game series, starring Michael Fassbender, Marion Cotillard, Jeremy Irons and Brendan Gleeson

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three previous restaurants he tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he heads for West Babylon, New York, where he helped the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts, before returning to Davide in Boston, an Italian restaurant run by two warring brothers. Finally, he visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island, run by hot-headed owner Abby

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Bill Nighy narrates a trip through Wales' highest peaks and deepest valleys. Starting in Pwllheli in the north west, the route heads along the lines that were built during the slate industry's heyday. At Porthmadog, the journey briefly switches to the reconstructed steam trains of the Welsh Highland National Heritage Railway to Minffordd station. Nearby is the village of Portmeirion, famous for its role in the classic TV series The Prisoner. Rejoining the Cambrian Line, local farmers reveal what the railway means to them, before the route takes in the seaside resort of Aberdovey

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: The singer heads to Alaska, America's largest state and home to some of the most breathtaking scenery on the planet. She takes a helicopter trip up to an ice field for a dog-sledding adventure, and later witnesses the majesty of the Margery glacier, a 21-mile stretch of ice in the Glacier Bay National Park. On board Holland America's ship Nieuw Amsterdam, Jane goes backstage to meet the cast of the nightly musicals, has a cooking lesson from the executive chef and reveals how to make the most of a lazy day in port

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow profiles scientist, engineer, inventor and painter Leonardo da Vinci, whose extraordinary artistic genius gave rise to masterpieces including the Mona Lisa, the Annunciation and the Last Supper. Breaking new ground in portraiture and historical imagery, this giant of the Italian Renaissance used his wide-ranging skills to make a unique contribution to the development of European art

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Paul Binski visits Liverpool's two cathedrals, which lie at either end of Hope Street. Despite having been built within 60 years of each other they represent starkly contrasting styles, the Anglican edifice being a vast tribute to neo-Gothic design and its Catholic counterpart a typical example of 1960s modernism

programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The West Highland Line is one of the world's truly legendary train routes, crossing spectacular Scottish moors and mountains as it heads towards Skye. Starting in Glasgow, it glides towards Loch Lomond, the world's largest inland stretch of water. It then sweeps north to enter the wild and windswept landscape of Rannoch Moor. After ascending to Corrour, Britain's highest station, the journey passes Ben Nevis, the UK's tallest mountain and then across the famous Glenfinnan viaduct. The coastal town of Mallaig is gateway to the Isle of Skye with its world-famous Highland cuisine and many breathtaking views

programme.title: Santiago of the Seas

programme.title: Baby Shark's Big Show!

programme.title: Sunny Bunnies

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Emily asks Ross to move away from his friends, while Monica and Rachel are understandably taken aback to meet a hairy man who they mistake for a yeti. American comedy, starring David Schwimmer and Helen Baxendale

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross moves in with Chandler and Joey, but the transition does not go as smoothly as expected. Danny deals Rachel's ego a blow by introducing her to an exceptionally dull date, and Phoebe becomes disillusioned with the health inspector she is seeing

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey tries to cover up Chandler and Monica's relationship - but only succeeds in making himself look stupid. Phoebe persuades Rachel to take a literature class with her, while Ross falls out with his co-workers, convinced one of them stole his prized sandwich

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross struggles to come to terms with life as one of the unemployed, and turns to Joey for advice. Rachel is disturbed by her new boyfriend's uncomfortably close relationship with his sister. Comedy, starring David Schwimmer and Jennifer Aniston

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Horse-rescue boss Jill rushes to the aid of an animal abandoned at a roadside. Young couple Nicole and Aaron plan to buy and refurbish a campervan so they can travel the world putting on fitness boot camps. Former call-centre employee Courtney and her boyfriend Michael get the chance to run their own bar, although their boss is soon piling on the pressure to get it open as soon as possible

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Christian and Mandy, the organisers of the annual Pride festival, are 4,000 euros short of the 18,000 required to stage the weekend-long party - and if that were not bad enough, the costumes are seven sizes too big. With two weeks left, can the duo save the day? Cameras also follow bar owner Cath as she prepares to host a hen party for 14 excited Northern Irish women and Leeds lad Peter, who publishes a free pocket guide to the Costa del Sol

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Mandy and Christian's Pride parade finally arrives, but what begins as a stressful day only gets worse when the generator powering the speakers packs up. Can the duo turn things around or will the the revellers be expected to dance to a silent soundtrack? Meanwhile, cockney limo driver Johnny Diamond books two big jobs on the same night, and Bury couple Andy and Sue settle in to their static caravan in the Spanish countryside

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: A new arrival in Saydo Park discovers the joys of drag at the age of 66, while a family running a British convenience store needs to make some money to move to a bigger home. Pub owners Sarah and Simon take a group of their regulars on a cliffside walk through the El Chorro gorge, here one of the party has to confront her fear of heights

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jane explores more of what Australia has to offer, beginning in the hotspot Surfer's Paradise - although her hopes of taking to the waves are dashed when an unexpected storm hits. She does, however, have a go at indoor skydiving and tries various relaxation therapies before heading to the west coast, where she begins her cruise on the ship featured in the remake of cult TV show The Love Boat. Also on the itinerary are visits to the war memorials of Albany, the starting point of the Anzac campaign in the First World War, and Fremantle Prison, where she heads into spooky underground tunnels built by prisoners

programme.title: When Holidays Go Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Accounts of nightmare vacations from those whose dream break went horribly wrong, including a woman horrified to see her young children paddling in what she believed to be sewage. Plus, the beachgoer who found herself upside down and clinging on for dear life during a parasailing excursion we Horribly Wrong, and a day trip to Brighton that ended up a sunseeker being chased by a hungry flock of seagulls. Jenny Powell narrates, with contributors including broadcaster Dermot Murnaghan, travel journalist Simon Calder and DJ Sonny Jay

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Before They Were Royal
programme.desc: A profile of the socialite, focusing on her early years before she met the future Edward VIII, asking whether she was a scheming seductress or one of the most maligned women in history. Her first marriage, to a heavy-drinking US naval officer, was a tempestuous on-off relationship, and in 1928, she married her first British husband, Ernest Aldrich Simpson, an English-American shipping executive. However, it wasn't until three years later that she was introduced to the Prince of Wales at an event at Burrough Court - a meeting that was to spark an infamous period in British history

programme.title: Philip: Elizabeth's One & Only
programme.desc: A profile of King Charles' father, exploring how he dealt with giving up his promising naval career and his surname as he took a back seat to his wife Elizabeth II. From his charity patronages, to founding the Duke of Edinburgh Award and becoming an unlikely champion of environmental issues, his life as Britain's longest-serving royal consort was a significant one for the entire nation

programme.title: Buckingham Palace with Alexander Armstrong
programme.desc: The actor examines the history of the residence from the just before the outbreak of the Second World War to the present and look at what the future holds. Raksha Dave examines a memoir written by George VI's family nanny that lifted the lid on the reality of life in the palace, while JJ Chalmers takes cover in an air-raid shelter just like the one in Buckingham Palace's cellar to find out how it survived the Blitz.

programme.title: Top of the Box
programme.desc: Matthew Kelly takes a look back at the most popular TV shows of 1989. The stars of Bread reflect on filming their Christmas special, Neighbours star Mark Little recalls how Australian soaps took British TV by storm, and Byker Grove star Lyndyann Barrass explores the year's best children's programmes. Other shows featured include Only Fools and Horses, The Bill, 'Allo 'Allo! and Birds of a Feather

programme.title: Scandal: The Major-Currie Affair
programme.desc: The story of how Edwina Currie shocked the nation when she revealed in her diaries that she and former prime minister John Major had embarked on an affair between 1984 and 1988. The programme using first-hand testimonies, archive footage and dramatic reconstruction to examine what led the MPS to succumb to their base desires, with contemporaries, journalists and comedians bringing their own perspectives to the tale

programme.title: PlayOJO Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Britain's Great Cathedrals with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: Built more than 1,400 years ago, Canterbury Cathedral is both a holy place and a World Heritage site. It is the 'mother church' for more than 85 million people, and one of the biggest tourist attractions in the UK with nearly a million visitors a year. Tony tells the tale of the cathedral's founding and how, after the cathedral burnt down, it was rebuilt by the Normans as a symbol of their power. He also explores how it became wealthy thanks to its role as a major site of pilgrimage following the infamous murder of Archbishop Thomas Becket

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow charts the life and work of celebrated Renaissance sculptor, architect and painter Michelangelo, most famous for the extraordinary scenes that adorn the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel in the Vatican

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Dr Paul Binski, Professor of the History of Medieval Art at Cambridge University visits Leicester and Neasden, north-west London, to view some spectacular examples of Hindu and Jain art

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Alex and Daring Danny X go snowboarding and head straight for Risky Ridge, leaving the Paw Patroller struggling to get to them in time

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet finds out how the Romans made their mosaics, and the Milkshakers! create some of their own

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Carlos and Tracker call the Paw Patrol to help solve the mystery of a rumbling sound that is upsetting the jungle elephants

programme.title: Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted (2012)
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals continue their quest to get back to their New York home. Having made it to Monte Carlo, they join a circus on a European tour as a means of travelling undetected - but an animal control agent is in hot pursuit. Animated comedy, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith

programme.title: Song of the Sea (2014)
programme.desc: The last surviving member of a race of magical seal-children seeks the aid of her human brother for a special quest. The two of them set out on a journey to revive the seal's magical powers and prevent the spirit world from being lost forever. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Lucy O'Connell, David Rawle and Brendan Gleeson

programme.title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (2018)
programme.desc: After being bitten by a radioactive arachnid, student Miles Morales develops incredible abilities, and becomes a version of Spider-Man. When a super collider device opens a gateway to other dimensions, Miles crosses paths with five counterparts to stop a threat for all realities. Oscar-winning animated adventure, with the voices of Shameik Moore and Nicolas Cage

programme.title: Arabian Nights (1942)
programme.desc: The story of two half-brothers - one the heroic caliph, the other an evil usurper - as they do battle for the right to rule their kingdom, and win the hand of beautiful dancer Sherazade. Adaptation of the classic adventure tales, starring Jon Hall, Maria Montez, Sabu and Leif Erickson

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond (2016)
programme.desc: The USS Enterprise sets out on a rescue mission which turns out to be a deadly trap set by a mysterious warlord. The crew are left stranded on an unexplored planet, and join forces with a fugitive alien scavenger to find a way off the hostile world and prevent a terrible weapon being unleashed upon the galaxy. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Idris Elba

programme.title: Inside Man (2006)
programme.desc: A police hostage negotiator is called in when a robbery turns into a siege. The chairman of the bank involved is worried the mastermind behind the heist is set to disclose secrets he needs to stay hidden, so he enlists the help of a political fixer. However, the elaborate nature of the thief's plan looks set to keep him one step ahead of the law, and causes problems for the detective assigned to rectify the situation. Spike Lee's thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Clive Owen, Jodie Foster, Christopher Plummer, Willem Dafoe and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: No Way Out (1987)
programme.desc: A navy officer unwittingly has an affair with a politician's mistress, and becomes involved in the investigation after she is murdered. However, he soon suspects the plan is to find a scapegoat rather than the real killer - and that he is the most likely candidate to take the fall. Political thriller, starring Kevin Costner, Gene Hackman, Sean Young, Iman and George Dzundza

programme.title: Jackie (2016)
programme.desc: Following the assassination of her husband, President John F Kennedy, Jacqueline Kennedy battles with grief and trauma to regain her faith, console her children, and define JFK's legacy. Director Pablo Larrain's Bafta-winning drama, starring Natalie Portman, Peter Sarsgaard and Greta Gerwig. Mica Levi provided the Oscar-nominated score

programme.title: Wonder Park (2019)
programme.desc: June, a science-loving little girl, and her mother spend hours playing with stuffed animals and other toys, fashioning a world of imagination connected to a fabulous theme park. When June's mom is diagnosed with a life-threatening illness and has to go away for treatment, June finds a real version of her theme park. Animated family adventure, with the voices of Mila Kunis and Jennifer Garner

programme.title: The Red Turtle (2016)
programme.desc: After a devastating storm leaves him shipwrecked on a deserted island, a nameless mariner must find a way to survive. After several failed attempts to sail off into the vast oceans on rafts built from bamboo, he encounters a red turtle, and the two strike up an unspoken bond. Animated fantasy, starring Emmanuel Garijo. In French and Japanese

programme.title: The Long Arm (1956)
programme.desc: A dedicated Scotland Yard police superintendent battles to overcome stress both at home and work, while putting his instincts and scientific knowledge to the task of catching a notorious safecracker. However, the case takes a shocking turn when the elusive criminal commits murder. Crime thriller, starring Jack Hawkins, Dorothy Alison, Geoffrey Keen and Newton Blick

programme.title: The Far Country (1954)
programme.desc: A cowpoke is steering his cattle north to the Canadian border when a corrupt sheriff commandeers the herd. A local saloon-bar owner falls for the hapless cowboy, and with her help he recaptures his cattle. Hooking up with a wagon train, the couple head for the mining town of Dawson, but the thwarted and embittered sheriff is on their tail. Western, with James Stewart, Walter Brennan and Ruth Roman

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World (2003)
programme.desc: The captain of a British warship engages in a tense battle of wits and an escalating test of nerves with a French counterpart during the Napoleonic conflict, a pursuit that takes his crew on a dangerous journey along the coast of South America. Seafaring drama, adapted from Patrick O'Brian's novels, starring Russell Crowe, Paul Bettany, James D'Arcy, Billy Boyd and Edward Woodall

programme.title: The Book of Eli (2010)
programme.desc: A man travels across a post-apocalyptic America carrying a book believed to hold the key to mankind's future. He encounters trouble in a desolate town and finds himself pursued by a despotic leader who will stop at nothing to get his hands on the text. Action adventure, starring Denzel Washington, Gary Oldman, Mila Kunis, Ray Stevenson and Jennifer Beals

programme.title: Bad Boys (1995)
programme.desc: Detectives Mike Lowrey and Marcus Burnett search for a $100million heroin consignment brazenly stolen by a French drug kingpin from the police evidence room. However, after a mix-up over a phone call from a potential witness, each cop has to assume the other's identity - Lowrey becoming the henpecked family man and Burnett the playboy. Michael Bay's action thriller, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Tea Leoni, Tcheky Karyo and Theresa Randle

programme.title: Total Recall (2012)
programme.desc: A man living in a bleak future years after a nuclear war has fake memories of being a secret agent implanted into his brain. However, the procedure uncovers the fact that he really is a spy with his memory erased, and he is forced to become a fugitive from the totalitarian government. Sci-fi thriller remake, with Colin Farrell, Kate Beckinsale and Jessica Biel

programme.title: Puss in Boots (2011)
programme.desc: The swashbuckling feline joins forces with a cunning thief and a treacherous old friend to steal a magical golden goose from a giant's castle. He must save the day when it transpires that their actions have unleashed a terrible danger on his home town. Animated comedy spin-off from the Shrek movies, with the voices of Antonio Banderas and Salma Hayek

programme.title: The Cat in the Hat (2003)
programme.desc: Two bored youngsters are led on a series of zany misadventures when a manic moggy comes knocking at their door with a magical stovepipe hat on his head and mischief in mind. Comedy fantasy based on the children's book by Dr Seuss, starring Mike Myers, Alec Baldwin, Dakota Fanning and Spencer Breslin

programme.title: Secret Headquarters (2022)
programme.desc: Fourteen-year-old Charlie Kincaid yearns for a deeper connection to his father Jack, who frequently disappears at short notice for work. When an IT conference interrupts Charlie's birthday, the teenager invites friends to a party at his father's house, and they stumble upon a subterranean, gizmo-laden lair. Comedy adventure, starring Owen Wilson, Walker Scobell and Michael Pena

programme.title: Daddy Day Care (2003)
programme.desc: Two unemployed executives decide to open a day-care centre, believing they have found an easy way to make a profit - but instead discover looking after a horde of rampant kids is not as simple as it seems. Family comedy, starring Eddie Murphy, Jeff Garlin, Steve Zahn and Anjelica Huston

programme.title: Catch Me If You Can (2002)
programme.desc: The story of Frank Abagnale Jr, who found notoriety as a teenager conning and charming his way across America. Posing as a pilot, a doctor and a lawyer, Frank was able to fund an extravagant lifestyle while outwitting the FBI at every turn. Fact-based drama, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Tom Hanks, Christopher Walken, Martin Sheen and James Brolin

programme.title: Man on Fire (2004)
programme.desc: A former US government operative battling with an addiction to alcohol is hired as a bodyguard to the nine-year-old daughter of a wealthy businessman in Mexico City. When the girl is abducted, he swears vengeance on those responsible while setting out on a dangerous, revenge-fuelled rescue mission. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Christopher Walken, Radha Mitchell and Dakota Fanning

programme.title: American Psycho (2000)
programme.desc: A financier in 1980s New York tries desperately to present an image of success and outshine his peers in the business world, while secretly committing horrific acts of rape, torture and murder for his own enjoyment. His carefully ordered life begins to unravel when a detective investigates his crimes. Satirical drama based on Bret Easton Ellis's novel, starring Christian Bale, Willem Dafoe and Reese Witherspoon

programme.title: Monsters and Men (2018)
programme.desc: An African-American man named Darius Larson is killed by one of six cops in New York City. The aftermath is revealed through the eyes of the bystander who filmed the act, a police officer, and a gifted high-school baseball player who is inspired to take a stand. Thriller, starring John David Washington and Anthony Ramos

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Darren can't find a way to get through to his son and starts blaming himself. Meanwhile, Ethan and Sienna try to spend some time together, but Norma interrupts

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna decides that she wants to be with Ethan and that she has to call things off with Rafe. Sharon turns to her family for guidance, and Maxine struggles with her self esteem

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Brick Hotel in Newtown, Pennsylvania, where the staff have had enough of owner Verindar, who runs the establishment like an angry tyrant. Can Gordon convince her to value her loyal workers and entice customers back to this landmark hotel?

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits the Beachfront Inn and Inlet, a Caribbean-style resort hotel in Fort Pierce, Florida. Young and inexperienced owner Brian is making guests' time at the hotel miserable with dusty rooms, late-night concerts and poor service. Can Gordon prevent the business from going under?

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Meemaw is pursued by two gentlemen callers, only for Sheldon to interfere, forcing her to set some ground rules. Richard Kind and Wallace Shawn guest star, with Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The prodigy dismantles the refrigerator to stop it making an annoying humming noise and is then forced to get a paper round to pay for the repairs to the damaged appliance. Comedy spin-off prequel to The Big Bang Theory, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The division incurs another personnel change that threatens to put Jake and Amy's budding relationship at risk. Meanwhile, Terry assists Holt with an important public relations matter and Rosa and Gina try to convince Charles to rethink his affection for a fellow officer. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake thinks Boyle might have met his soulmate in Genevieve, an art gallery owner, and tries to set the pair up on a date. Meanwhile, Rosa deals with an intra-precinct theft and Amy seeks Holt's help with an image campaign. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Emmy-winning comedy returns - as do Cameron and Mitchell, who are back from honeymoon and determined to keep the romance alive. Cameron, however, takes it just a little step too far. The Dunphys, meanwhile, have been enjoying a relaxing summer without smart-alec Alex, who is away on a trip - although she threatens to rock the boat after arriving home early - and Gloria shows a different side after arguing with Jay about the lack of effort he puts into his appearance

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Gloria celebrate their anniversary, but cannot decide on what kind of gift to give each other. Meanwhile, the Dunphys join Alex on her college tour and Phil, Luke and Haley find themselves in a mirrored waiting room with a button and a sign that says 'Do Not Push'. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon goes to Las Vegas and does everything he can to win a large sum of money for science. Meanwhile, Penny and Bernadette take Amy shopping for a wedding dress, but her terrible choice entangles them in a web of lies

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Sheldon learns that his mother won't attend his wedding unless he invites his brother Georgie, he and Leonard travel to Texas to end a family feud. Meanwhile, Howard and Bernadette's children inadvertently give them, Amy and Raj conjunctivitis. Jerry O'Connell guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy pulls out all the stops as she hosts a traditional Victorian Christmas Eve dinner for the friends. Meanwhile, Raj's father comes to visit, and the guys do their best to free a bird they accidentally let into the university clean room. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj endures an anxious day as he worries that a space probe he helped design will not function properly, while Leonard and Sheldon agree to go clothes shopping with Penny and Amy. Comedy, starring Kunal Nayyar, Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin and Marty consider starting a new business together. Dave sets up a small library stocked with a self-help book he wrote

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When a mountain lion gets loose in the neighbourhood, the Butlers and Johnsons must shelter together, which leads to some unexpected revelations

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys and Manny are on their way back from breakfast at the pancake house when Phil is forced to swerve out of the way of an oncoming truck, a brush with death that prompts them all to re-evaulate their lives. Comedy, starring Ty Burrell

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire confronts neighbours from hell Ronnie and Amber about the eyesore of a boat on their front lawn - and when they refuse to move it, Phil has no alternative but to call in the big guns - dad Frank and a few of his retired pals. Meanwhile, Cam takes Lily to clown school

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Holt and Peralta contract mumps during an investigation, so the pair elect to be quarantined together in the hope that they can use the time to solve the case. Diaz tries to help Boyle through the mourning process for his dog, and Jeffords is forced to clean up Hitchcock and Scully's mess. Oscar Nunez guest stars

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta and Santiago are excited to go on their first real holiday together, but their perfectly planned cruise ship itinerary is thwarted when they discover that an old adversary is on board. Boyle and Diaz vie for the same apartment, while Gina and Jeffords help Captain Holt to survive a visit from his sister Debbie

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys become stranded in the middle of nowhere when Leonard's car is stolen en route to the Bakersfield comic-book convention. Meanwhile, back at home, the women try to work out why the guys are so fascinated with such publications

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is furious when the university forces him to work with Kripke, while Howard's hobby lands him in financial trouble. However, that doesn't stop him and Raj getting expensive action figures of themselves made - much to Bernadette's disapproval

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy are devastated after learning from a Russian paper that Super Asymmetry has already been discovered and disproved. Bernadette wants to beat Howard in a video game

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: Hunter tries to tell Freya their relationship is strictly student and teacher. Sienna questions Ethan on his whereabouts when he fails to return home

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: When Sheldon is no longer academically challenged at Medford High School, he audits a college class taught by his pen pal Dr John Sturgis. Wallace Shawn and Michael Cudlitz guest star alongside Iain Armitage

programme.title: Taskmaster Bleeped
programme.desc: Contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin continue to address the challenges set for them by Greg Davies. It's nearly the end of the series, and the pressure is so intense that Mae immediately forgets the only rule to a task. Greg demands to be educated about history - but the five comics only seem to know about the year 1066. And there's paint, stomping, poor time-keeping and some impressively sneaky prizes in this quazi semi-final. As usual, Alex Horne helps maintain order

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Two divorcees go in search of a more successful match, and a woman who despairs of ever finding the right man finds her head turned from her date to another man in the restaurant. A barbershop owner tries to settle his nerves by drinking heavily before the date, and an unconventional neuroscientist looks for love with an artistic woman who has always put other people's needs first, but now wants something for herself

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 19-year-old student Marlie from Yorkshire, who keeps choosing the bad boys - which is driving her mum mad. There's also 30-year-old Adam, from Bradford. Having previously had his heart broken, he is now looking for a woman with no secrets, and believes that if the contestants are willing to bare all on TV, they probably have nothing to hide

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: Rick, still in galactic prison, puts an intricate escape plan into action. Back on Earth - now under Federation control - Morty and Summer have an argument about their grandfather that gets out of control

programme.title: Celebs Go Dating
programme.desc: Vanessa goes head-to-head with Paul and Anna, while Adam and Lottie's romance looks like it'll be cut short when Adam makes a shocking decision

programme.desc: The deck team get into choppy waters during a rough docking, while Parker feels the strain of being on charter and his immaturity begins to show

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Meemaw is pursued by two gentlemen callers, only for Sheldon to interfere, forcing her to set some ground rules. Richard Kind and Wallace Shawn guest star, with Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: When the children ask some tough questions about a highly publicised court case involving alleged police brutality and an African-American teenager, Dre and his parents think they need to know what kind of world they're living in. However, Rainbow wants to give them a more hopeful view about life. Anthony Anderson stars

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: When Jack and Diane have to create biographical projects about each other at school, Diane decides to shoot a documentary on Jack's budding basketball career. programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna decides that she wants to be with Ethan and that she has to call things off with Rafe. Sharon turns to her family for guidance, and Maxine struggles with her self esteem

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Loudonville, Ohio, to rescue Landoll's Mohican Castle, a custom-built, multimillion-dollar hotel set in an 1100-acre woodland estate. Co-owner Marta is struggling, having been left with the entire burden of running such a large establishment alone. Can Gordon persuade her son Jimmy to finally take the reins and turn this business around before the family legacy is destroyed?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Babylon in New York, where the peace of Long Island is regularly shattered by the volatile Pellegrino family, proprietors of Peter's Italian Restaurant. Gordon finds owner Tina's work to save the eatery from oblivion is frequently ruined by the behaviour of her brother, a tyrannical front-of-house manager whose violent temper constantly undermines staff morale

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Meemaw intervenes when Sheldon gets jealous of Dr Sturgis bonding with Paige, a rival 10-year-old genius. In the meantime, Mary invites Paige's family over for a play date

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Following a tragic accident in the local community, Mary's faith is shaken. Seeing his mother doubt everything she believes, Sheldon becomes an unlikely ally. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage and Zoe Perry

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: While investigating a serial killer, Peralta enlists Holt's help in an attempt to solve the case without the new captain finding out. Diaz and Santiago are forced to deal with the murderer's demands, while Jeffords discovers a new obsession. Comedy, guest starring Kyra Sedgwick and Dean Winters, with Andy Samberg

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake and Holt split the squad into two teams to help them win the Halloween heist contest. Each side attempts to steal the same item, a fancy-dress crown locked in a briefcase in the interrogation room in order to claim the title of 'amazing detective or genius'

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil comes across footage of an incriminating sneeze while looking at Cameron and Mitchell's wedding video that proves he is responsible for the family's flu epidemic, so he sets about getting rid of the proof with the help of Luke and some creative editing. Claire struggles to make it through an important business meeting while feeling under the weather, while Cam is forced to make a difficult decision when it comes to Manny and the school football team. Mitch meets Lily's know-it-all friend and male nanny Andy (Andy DeVine) makes a welcome return

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys move into a hotel while their house is being treated for mould, but when they are forced to share a single room, cabin fever soon sets in. Gloria worries after finding out that Manny is dating one of the popular girls at school, while Cam's attempt to keep his football team's unprecedented winning streak going is threatened by a 'cursed' Mitchell

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Friends and family gather as Amy and Sheldon prepare to tie the knot - but it seems the happy couple's minds are elsewhere. Jim Parsons and Mayim Bialik star, with guest appearances from Laurie Metcalf, Kathy Bates, Mark Hamill, Jerry O'Connell and Teller (the quiet half of US magic duo Penn and Teller)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy's honeymoon runs aground in New York, Penny and Leonard discover that they are uncomfortably similar to Amy's parents, while Raj insults astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson and starts a war on social media. Kathy Bates and Teller (of Penn and Teller fame) guest star as Amy's parents

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon becomes concerned that his comfortable lifestyle is having an impact on his professional progress and is stopping him from achieving scientific greatness, so he asks the gang to make life more difficult for him. Meanwhile, Howard invents an unflattering game about Raj. Starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon are forced to defend themselves against criticism from an online bully after publishing a physics paper. Meanwhile, the girls confront embarrassing moments from their pasts during a night in. Comedy, guest starring Stephen Hawking, with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin struggles to find the perfect birthday gift for Tina. Gemma tries to get some VIP tickets, through a connection to actor Jerry O'Connell

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin and Marty struggle to find financing for their new business. Gemma is annoyed when Dave invites his boss to Grover's 13th birthday party

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil takes it hard when Luke gives him the 'teenage cold shoulder' - a day he always knew was coming - so he goes in search of a stand-in son. A dilemma presents itself for Jay when Gloria suspects Joe is allergic to Stella, while Mitchell does some freelance legal work for Claire, an experience he finds rather enlightening

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Valentine's Day arrives, which for the Dunphys means their chance to dress up and romance each other as their once-a-year role-play characters Clive and Juliana - although Claire begins to worry that Phil prefers her like this. Meanwhile, Jay's romantic plans hit a snag in the sassy form of Gloria's sister Sonia, who ends up trying to seduce him, and wires are crossed when Mitch and Cam find themselves in a sticky situation with pal Anders

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: On his birthday, Peralta takes Santiago to meet his mother, but an unexpected appearance by his father spoils his special day. Diaz and Boyle struggle with a new mandate on body cams while on a stakeout with Jeffords, while Gina forgets to inform the precinct when Captain Holt comes up with an important plan. Katey Sagal and Bradley Whitford guest star

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Chaos ensues when a plumbing emergency forces staff from a neighbouring station to work temporarily from the Nine-Nine precinct, and Boyle becomes jealous of Peralta's old partner. Cop comedy, guest starring Damon Wayans Jr

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: An argument between Leonard and Sheldon over the ending of a Harry Potter book affects Amy and Penny's living arrangements. Meanwhile, Howard goes on a trip to Las Vegas with Bernadette and asks Raj to keep an eye on his mother while he is away

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny celebrate Valentine's Day, but their evening takes a turn for the worse when the latter's ex-boyfriend proposes to his girlfriend in the same restaurant. Meanwhile, Sheldon enlists the help of his assistant Alex to find the perfect gift for Amy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon becomes jealous when Amy gets attention in the media, Raj spots Anu talking to her ex-boyfriend, and Stuart is intimidated by the idea of moving in with Denise, all of which cause mayhem when Penny and Leonard organise a paintball game

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny's former boyfriend Zack and his wife encounter fertility problems when wanting a baby, so ask Leonard for his help. Raj attempts to patch things up with his estranged fiancee Anu

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A struggling Charlie isolates himself by pushing out his friends and family. Meanwhile, Maxine decides to take matters into her own hands

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A neighbourhood battle erupts between the Coopers and the Sparks family when the Sparks' new dog terrorises Sheldon. US comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Taskmaster Bleeped
programme.desc: The grand final finds courageous contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin fighting to gain the most points to win Greg Davies's golden head. For their last act, they contemplate using a hose, create something soothing for two very specific professions and have an incredibly intense game of face-changing chess with Alex Horne, but who will reign supreme in this unparalleled gladiatorial arena?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: A special celebrity edition in support of Stand Up to Cancer, with Tom Daley and Dustin Lance Black, Charlotte Church and Luke Evans, and Gordon and Tilly Ramsay joining the regular cast. Programmes appraised include The Watcher, I Can See Your Voice, Love Is Blind, Only Connect, personal stories in Channel 4's Stand Up to Cancer strand, and ITV News coverage on the transition of power in Downing Street to Rishi Sunak

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Memorable moments of the year, featuring some of the country's favourite celebrities critiquing TV shows that they have watched. The line-up of famous faces includes Clare Balding and Alice Arnold, Gyles Brandreth and Maureen Lipman, Lorraine Kelly and her daughter Rosie, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, Mo Gilligan and Babatunde Aleshe, Tom Jones and Anne-Marie, and Shaun Ryder and Bez. Shows appraised include Masked Dancer, First Dates, Quizness, The Handmaid's Tale, Secret Crush, Extreme Sisters, Sex/Life and Celebrity Karaoke Club

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson guides two more singletons on the dating show based naked attraction alone. First into the studio is 26-year-old Adele from Scotland. After beating cancer, Adele wants to live life to the full and find a guy who feels the same. She is followed by 22-year-old Jack from Manchester. After a dramatic four-stone weight-loss, Jack wants to show off his new body and attract the one for him

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 24-year-old beautician Gemma from West Sussex. She has dated a few love rats and is now searching for her Prince Charming. She is followed by 28-year-old bisexual tattoo artist Jennafer, who is fed up of men and now wants to find the perfect woman. Will any of the contestants be just what Jennafer is looking for?

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys have to teach the world's most uncoordinated karate class and pose as newspaper reporters. They also head out into the street with a massage chair to offer free neck and head rubs. This episode's loser is challenged to steal a stranger's underwear from a laundry basket and wear them on his head

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys steal food from customers' plates in a restaurant and try to teach languages they cannot speak. Hidden camera practical joke show following comedy troupe The Tenderloins

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the spoof documentary following the dedicated teachers and the inept principal of a Philadelphia school. Starring Quinta Brunson

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: Janine takes it upon herself to fix every problem in the school when she notices a flickering lightbulb in the hallway, while Gregory asks Barbara for help talking to a parent

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht
programme.desc: Adam and Jenna's relationship heats up, which stokes the fires between Jenna and her interior team, while Ciara and Parker get in a spat about deck duties

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: When things fall behind on the domestic front, Rainbow persuades Dre to hire a nanny. programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: When Dre and Rainbow realise they haven't nominated a legal guardian for their children, they make it their mission to find replacement parents, just in case anything happens to them. Zoey and Andre Jr reveal the truth to Jack about the death of their old dog and various other family secrets

programme.title: Lego Masters New Zealand
programme.desc: The four remaining teams must build an emotional work of art made entirely from just one colour, creating a sculpture good enough for an art gallery

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the River Rock Inn in Milford, Pennsylvania, where owner Ken Pisciotta is struggling to attract guests and battling huge debts. He has all but given up and his constant negativity is rubbing off on the staff. Can Gordon get this establishment back on track before Ken loses everything?

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Supercar fanatic Eddie Kaen has spent millions on the design of the Keating in San Diego, California, but neglected to invest in things the guests really need. Gordon Ramsay's visit uncovers empty rooms, a failing restaurant and staff at the end of their tether - leading to a shocking crisis that nobody saw coming

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay visits Meson de Mesilla, a Tuscan-style hotel in Las Cruces, New Mexico. Owner and former child-star Cali Szczawinski purchased the hotel so she could perform Cher songs every night to a captive audience, but Gordon investigates whether she may be falling flat when it comes to the needs of her guests because she's too busy trying to hit the high notes on stage

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in at the 90-year-old Monticello Hotel in Longview, Washington, where owner Phillip Lovingfoss has an apparent liking for alcohol that some of his staff claim is threatening to destroy the business. The challenge of turning around the hotel's fortunes only increases when the chef sees shocking allegations about Phillip splashed all over the front page of the local newspaper

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire becomes a neighbourhood vigilante in the hope of stopping a motorist who has begun speeding through local streets. Jay teaches Manny to ride a bike, before discovering Gloria also needs lessons, while Mitch and Cameron befriend zany stranger Barry. Guest starring James Marsden (X-Men)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell makes a disturbing discovery following an awkward encounter with an old high-school flame, and wonders whether he unknowingly fathered a child in his 'straight' days. Feeling intellectually inferior to Alex, Phil and Claire try to enjoy a subtitled film, while Jay regrets getting on the wrong side of Gloria

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Haley, Alex and Luke decide to surprise Phil and Claire with breakfast in bed, only to catch them in a compromising position. Mitch and Cameron arrange a play date for Lily, hoping to befriend a fellow parent who also happens to own a swanky new restaurant, and Gloria accidentally sends a nasty e-mail to Claire. Guest starring Rachael Harris (The Hangover)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Claire celebrate Valentine's Day with a meal at restaurant Ibiza, which is spoiled by their elderly fellow diners. However, the couple engage in role-play to spice up the evening, with Phil transformed into successful businessman Clive Bixby. Meanwhile, Jay and Gloria inject some competition into their special day, and Cameron grows weary of Mitchell's PA

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell throws Lily a party to celebrate her second birthday and invites his mother DeDe - who creates tension by bringing along Claire's former lover Robbie. Mitchell upsets Cameron by blacklisting Fizbo the clown from proceedings, and insists the entertainment should be provided by a fairy instead. Guest starring Shelley Long (Cheers) and Matt Dillon (Crash)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Paige drags Sheldon to a college party, while Missy gets caught out in a lie. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.desc: When Amy and Wil Wheaton get into a fight while filming Fun with Flags, Sheldon suffers the consequences of their fall-out. He ends up going to Penny for advice and after getting drunk, confronts the actor in a bid to make him apologise. Bernadette encourages Howard to move out of his mother's house

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends try to solve the mystery of Sheldon's post-lunch activities, following him to a secret room where they discover how he chills out. Elsewhere, Leonard is jealous when Penny starts texting a classmate, but things quickly change when Alex gets flirty with him

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels undermined when his parking space at the university is allocated to Howard instead, and his determination to cling on to the spot causes a rift in the pair's friendship. However, the battle between the boys pales in comparison to that waged by Amy and Bernadette, whose disagreement on behalf of their significant others becomes increasingly personal. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As part of the relationship agreement, Sheldon reluctantly has to take care of Amy when she gets sick, but she loves the extra attention so much she pretends to remain in poor health. Elsewhere, Howard tries to get some tips on manliness from Penny when he and Bernadette go to visit her father

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard tries to get Sheldon into the Christmas mood by playing a game, but things do not go as planned when Sheldon reveals a childhood trauma. Raj goes out with the girls and reveals he had crushes on both Penny and Bernadette - but not Amy. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is not pleased when his assistant Alex starts flirting with Leonard and has a word with her about it. Unfortunately, his comments are so inappropriate that he is accused of sexual harassment and sent to the university's human resources department, where he ends up dragging Leonard, Raj and Howard into trouble too. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: Grease (1978)
programme.desc: Rebellious American teenager Danny falls for innocent Australian girl Sandy during the summer holidays, but when he later finds out she is a new student at his school, he risks losing her love by trying to act cool in front of his friends. Romantic musical set in the 1950s, starring John Travolta, Olivia Newton-John, Stockard Channing, Jeff Conaway, Didi Conn and Sid Caesar

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics get in Eurovision mood as they sit down for the annual song contest. They also watch spy thriller Citadel, new dating show I Kissed a Boy, Open House: The Great Sex Experiment, as well as The Greatest Auction, Family Fortunes and The Big Celebrity Detox

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: An aspiring Paralympian goes on a date with a former footballer, while a double divorcee hopes to make it third time lucky, if her long list of very specific requirements do not hold her back. A car salesman ponders how to raise the subject of BDSM on his first date with a primary school teacher, and a previous visitor to the bar returns for a second try

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: A beauty queen bricklayer goes looking for love with a bar manager, while two students with very different priorities when it comes to conversation try to make a connection. A financial investigator meets a man who seems to have an answer to everything, and a man whose job takes him all over the world is under pressure to find himself a wife

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp teams up with potter Richard Miller to help Ellie and Nick Harrington - who have no practical DIY skills - create plates to complement their 1930s-style dining room in Tunbridge Wells, Kent

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Michelle and Bernard from Bolton first visited the stunning Italian city of Lucca a year ago and immediately fell in love with its traditional Tuscan charm and beautiful countryside. The couple now want to buy a holiday home in a nearby town or village, which they can enjoy with their whole family. Helping to fulfil their dream is Ben Hillman, who lines up five options up for their 75,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A Birmingham couple start a cooking school with a difference in France. A glampsite owner in Italy finds a potential pot of gold on her land and a Staffordshire couple have a devastating start to their new life in Spain

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel Britain searching for items to fix up and flog for their owners. In East Sussex and Hertfordshire, the duo's finds include a Victorian egg incubator

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel to the West Midlands and London, where finds include a potato oven and an old petrol pump

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A simple case becomes complicated when family secrets are uncovered, while another reveals a great-grandfather's life on the docks in the early days of diving. An uncle's part in the defeat of Nazi Germany in the Second World War is also highlighted. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be traced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Charing, Kent, where landlady Natalie Palmer hopes to show that her B&B, The Oak, is better than any of her guests' establishments. Everything starts off well when a couple are delighted to have enough room for their yoga mats, but the rest of the party are unimpressed with the extractor fans

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants visit the White Lady in Worstead, Norfolk, on their second night, where proprietor Dennis Gilligan tells his guests about a spooky presence that resides there. The guests get competitive in a round of clay shooting, and debate whether they believe in the existence of ghosts

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Cranleigh House B&B in Combe Martin, Devon, where former couple Katherine Armitage and Stewart Johnston offer alternative accommodation for those who enjoy yoga and are seeking spiritual enlightenment. They hope the group will send out energy for world peace and healing, but Mike and Denise question whether the whole thing is a joke

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mike and Denise Mitchell welcome the contestants to Beaches B&B in Paignton, Devon, which only opened for business a few weeks ago. Fellow competitor Katherine puts the owners through their paces at breakfast when she asks for something off the menu, and the hosts are pleasantly surprised at feedback time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together for one last time to discover what they have been paid, and the identity of the winner. The Oak owner Natalie wants to know why some of her guests were not enthused by her extractor fans, but she herself receives aggression from Dennis over her criticism of the White Lady. Katherine and Stuart defend their vegetarian breakfast, and Mike and Denise deal with negative comments about their cereal selection

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit the Payne-Durkins, on the rural outskirts of Leeds, to help Karl and Paul decide whether to renovate or sell their three-bedroom home. Karl loves the unique design and idyllic location, but Paul thinks they are too isolated, and would rather move to another area than spend the moving improving their current home

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Tortoises Burt and Terrance become rivals in love when they pursue a breeding female. Meanwhile, six-year-old okapi K'Tusha nears the end of her first pregnancy, and keepers hope that her baby will help to conserve this highly endangered species, and Asian elephant bull Aung-Bo senses that the three-day window for mating is about to begin

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Curious four-month-old terrier puppies Bobo and Lenny start scouting out their new surroundings at the centre. The brother and sister are completely different in looks and personality, but both need a forever home. Meanwhile, the staff bring together 82-year-old Alan and lhasa apso Ruby, both of whom are looking for comfort after losing a loved one

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows Lysette and Nigel Offley, who are knocking down an old Thames boathouse and constructing a cutting-edge home in its place. Taking inspiration from the river itself, they have designed a building of waves and curves with a huge glass porthole for a roof light. But problems begin almost from the start, as they cannot find a contractor willing to build over the water, their architect leaves unexpectedly and the costs turn out much higher than expected. To make matters worse, the neighbours are not happy about such a radical sight in their traditional community. As they begin to compromise, Kevin wonders if the couple's dreams will ever be realised

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Retired customs officer Keith has been living and working in New Zealand for 25 years. Now, he wants to return to the UK for part of the year and go touring the waterways of the UK with his wife Pam. He's commissioning a brand-spanking-new semi-cruiser narrowboat complete with all the latest gadgets. However, Keith has never owned a boat before, let alone skippered or crewed a narrowboat, so he needs to learn very quickly

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Peter Maddison meets Dr Shiva Gunapu and his psychologist wife Rima, who moved from India to Australia 15 years ago. Incorporating the rich colours of their Indian heritage is an essential element for their new home in Norwood in Adelaide, which they've spent three years designing

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sister Jen is on duty in resus looking after 48-year-old Bobby, who has been suffering from seizures at home. Bobby has spent most of his adult life in prison for a number of violent crimes including murder. Meanwhile, 70-year-old Ronald had to cut short his 46th wedding anniversary celebrations after experiencing breathing difficulties, and Rienelle, seven, receives treatment after falling from the top of a climbing frame at school

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who is in cardiac arrest. They fight to keep him alive while next door his wife hopes for a miracle, on their wedding anniversary. There are reports of a 16-year-old who has collapsed by a canal. Paramedics can see a light being waved at them, but in the dark it's not easy to find their patient. Plus, a mother calls 999 when her three-year-old is struggling to breathe

Meanwhile, 70-year-old Ronald had to cut short his 46th wedding anniversary celebrations after experiencing breathing difficulties, and Rienelle, seven, receives treatment after falling from the top of a climbing frame at school

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ex-RAF officers Simon Stenning and Amanda Butcher have been visiting the Caribbean island of Antigua for several years, and now hope to find the perfect winter home there. Ben Hillman helps the pair, showing them five properties for their 330,000 budget

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is taught how to bind books by expert Isabelle Ting, and reveals how to create a notebook from leftover materials including leather offcuts, recycled leather coats and decorative paper

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas is house hunting along the south-east coast of Cyprus with mother and daughter Pat and Tash from Reading, Berkshire. Pat has been longing to buy a holiday home for 20 years, but has always been too busy working and caring for her family to turn the dream into a reality. Now she's retired, she's finally seizing the moment, and is poised to consider the five options Scarlette has found for her within her 70,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A Yorkshire glampsite owner diversifies into olive oil farming in Italy, a cook from Birmingham teaches vegan cooking in France, and a couple are determined to rebuild their lives in Spain

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien come across a water trough and a cartwheel as they continue their mission to turn unwanted items into hard cash

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.title: Four in a Bed
