programme.desc: The third visit is to the family-run Dolphin Hotel in Exmouth, Devon, which has been a life's work for hotelier Jo Knowles. On arrival, Pat and Nigel find a suspicious stain, before the guests put on their war faces for a game of paintball. Jo takes everyone to a floating restaurant for dinner, and the next morning she presents a huge spread for breakfast - but her diners are suspicious that it has been laid on specially for the competition

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants stay at the Mariners Beachside B&B in Seaton, Devon, but are disappointed by the cleanliness of the property. They take part in a town-crying competition during the afternoon, and host Nigel feels under pressure to deliver his award-winning breakfast the next morning. Come feedback time, the owners discover not all their guests share the same opinion

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the final time to find out what they have been paid, and confront their rivals. Simon Bailey and Pierre Cudon from the Flower Pot feel the feedback left by Nigel and Pat Booth is a step too far, while the Mariners B&B owners hit back at the men's opinion of their establishment's cleanliness. Linda and Kelly Langdown of the Old Times Guest House question the rating of their facilities, while the Dolphin Hotel's Jo Knowles has a confession to make regarding her hosting

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Lindleys from Ashtead, Surrey. Having built up his business empire from home, cyber security expert Bill has inadvertently taken over their detached bungalow, and retired civil servant Pippa has had enough. She dreams of moving to Kent, where they can be closer to family and the coast

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: It's the festive season at Chester Zoo and the keepers are making sure everyone gets a gift, from the meerkats to the miniature monkeys. Christmas comes early with the birth of sun bear cub Kyra, but the new arrival proves a little over-adventurous and gets stuck up a tree. There's a yuletide ceasefire in the long turf war between the otters and the babirusas, the vets have terrible news about golden-headed tamarind Pru, and plucky spider Winston attempts to snag man-eater Ruby

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Nervous young labrador Loki arrives at the centre, and soon meets seasoned dog owner Sharron, a Royal Navy nurse. But will a recent injury prevent her from taking him in? Small terrier Midnight is also looking for a forever home, although when he is introduced to a couple dealing with the pain of not being able to have children, he only has eyes for one of them

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Mary Martin and Carl Turner want to build a home that resembles a giant stack of glass cubes in Brixton, south London. The couple are hoping the structure will become an instant landmark, while on the inside they are planning a Zen retreat. But to succeed, their finances must be pushed to their limit, so Carl takes on as many of the specialist jobs as he can to save money. Kevin McCloud follows their progress

programme.title: Rig 45: Murder at Sea
programme.desc: The lights go out on the rig and when the crew members manage to get them working again, they find that there has been a murder. Allegations fly and it's clear that there are two separate groups and the distrust is growing. Drama, starring Andrei Alen, Ciarn McMenamin, Dmitry Vinokurov and Lisa Henni. In English and Swedish

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The team treats 78-year-old Kevin, who suffered a cardiac arrest at the gym and fortunately received life-saving treatment at the scene from an instructor trained to use a portable defibrillator. Meanwhile, 23-year-old paramedic Declan is sent for an emergency CT scan, and Monica, 83, is experiencing numbness in her leg following a fall at home, and her initial X-ray appears to indicate she has a broken neck

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Four-year-old Alfie rushed in with a broken thighbone after falling off his bike, the medical team suspects 19-year-old rugby player Chris has suffered neck and spinal injuries, while James, 42, arrives with chest pains and breathing difficulties. Documentary following life inside one of Britain's busiest A&E departments at King's College Hospital in south London.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, as Sarah Millican and Nish Kumar take on Jon Richardson and Maisie Adam. David O'Doherty is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The team treats 78-year-old Kevin, who suffered a cardiac arrest at the gym and fortunately received life-saving treatment at the scene from an instructor trained to use a portable defibrillator. Meanwhile, 23-year-old paramedic Declan is sent for an emergency CT scan, and Monica, 83, is experiencing numbness in her leg following a fall at home, and her initial X-ray appears to indicate she has a broken neck

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Four-year-old Alfie rushed in with a broken thighbone after falling off his bike, the medical team suspects 19-year-old rugby player Chris has suffered neck and spinal injuries, while James, 42, arrives with chest pains and breathing difficulties. Documentary following life inside one of Britain's busiest A&E departments at King's College Hospital in south London.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Angela Keenan and Jon Benbow-Brown have visited Menorca five times together, and have fallen in love with the laid-back way of life on the island. The pair are planning to retire there full-time, so Ben Hillman shows them five houses on the island for their budget of 165,000

programme.title: Food Unwrapped Investigates
programme.desc: Kate Quilton investigates the 2019 listeria outbreak in UK hospitals that left six dead and asks if enough is being done to protect vulnerable patients from a failing food safety system. She meets scientists to uncover just what listeria is and how the outbreak happened, goes inside a hospital kitchen to see first-hand how food is made and speaks with an anonymous government whistleblower who reveals cutbacks could mean another deadly outbreak will happen again

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mel, David and their daughters are relocating from North Shields to the picturesque town of La Duquesa on Spain's Costa del Sol. Danni Menzies helps them find the perfect property with a pool for their 160,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Folk dancer Gay and drama teacher Stephen are relocating to Finistre in the north west of France, where they love the rugged coastline and beautiful medieval villages. Laura Hamilton lines up five properties for their 100,000 budget, hoping at least one will be just what they are looking for

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to the Borgue Hotel in Dumfries and Galloway, which owners Vince and Shirley Barrett run with military precision. On arrival, guests Adam and Naomi are not impressed with the decor, while Ken and Elaine do not like the orange towels. Later, over dinner, the hosts reveal who wears the trousers in their relationship, before Ken's jokes go down like a lead balloon

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Allscott Mill B&B in Telford, Shropshire, on their second night, where hosts Ken and Elaine Purchase welcome their guests. On arrival, Shirely and Vince find fault with the lack of headroom in their lodgings, while Adam and Naomi are bemused by the absence of a toilet brush in their bathroom

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Park House in Llandrindod Wells, Powys, where owners Ian and Joan Barr hope their colourful B&B will impress their guests. Adam and Naomi are wowed by the vibrant decor, but Ken and Elaine take issue with a dirty toilet brush

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Naomi and Adam Black welcome the contestants to East Thorne yurt retreat in Bude, Cornwall. They are pleased to discover it is Vince and Shirley's dream location, but Ken and Elaine don't share the same opinion. Later, the guests take part in an archery competition, and in the morning, are unimpressed with the DIY breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rival owners meet for the final time on the last day of the competition to find out what they've been paid and settle some scores. Hosting skills, breakfasts, facilities and two toilet brush gripes are aired before the cash is counted and the winner is announced

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two house-hunters who were searching for properties in 2002. They revisit anaesthetist Ian from Cheltenham, who was looking for a Regency property, and single mum Sehyr from Windsor, who was after a Victorian style home

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: In a series first, guest judge Philip Khoury, Harrods' head pastry chef, surprises the semi-finalists and sets their first challenge - his signature Dawn of a New Day dessert. In the second challenge the teams must create a miniature village scene complete with enough bche entremet and edible elements to serve 40 guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: in Cardiff, DJ Trishna hopes her cooking will be even better than her rapping, as she hosts a hip-hop themed night in a bid to scoop the 1000 prize. However, when Yuno shakes his booty on the dance floor, opera-loving Nick is unimpressed and flirty Michelle lets her hands do the talking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the second day of the competition in Cardiff and Nick is planning to bring some refinement and fine dining to the week's proceedings. However, fastidious Nick really has set himself a mountain to climb with a massive tasting menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the third day in Cardiff, retail manager Yuno hopes to scoop the prize by whisking his guests off to the Himalayas. As well as entertaining his guests with some traditional dancing, Yuno's also hoping to tickle their taste buds by serving up Nepalese food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's day four of the competition in Cardiff and turn of self-appointed 'hostess with the mostest' Michelle. She's out to impress with a culinary trip around the world, but when she sets a fun challenge, she ends up being accused of cheating

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night of the competition in Cardiff, host Suzanne is pinning her hopes on an evening of sophistication and fine French cuisine. Suzanne's menu is inspired by her many holidays to France - in fact she's been every year for the last 17 years. However, revealing the inspiration behind her starter might be a step too far for her guests, especially after the revelations found inside her 'special' cupboard!

programme.title: Remarkable Places to Eat
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix explores south Devon with chef Angela Hartnett, visiting a restaurant in Dartmouth with a reputation for serving some of the UK's finest seafood. They also board a boat to the River Exe Caf, a floating restaurant in the middle of the River Exe, and visit an independent restaurant in Totnes

programme.title: Bettany Hughes' Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany explores mountainous Albania, and journeys to epic fortress towns, breath-taking archaeological sites and encounters a richly diverse history and culture. She visits the ancient city of Butrint, meets remote communities in the spectacular Albanian Alps, and goes underground to the secret bunker of former communist dictator Enver Hoxha

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary follows the work of the stroke team at south London's King's College Hospital. Laura's family faces a big decision when the 72-year-old grandmother is found to have a blood clot on her brain, while father-of-three Nic, the over-40s National BMX Champion, collapses in reception after suffering an accident while training for a stunt. The medics also treat 83-year-old Marjorie, who is complaining of a pain behind her eye following a recent bout of shingles

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Brian, 74, is brought into King's by ambulance after falling backwards down a flight of stairs and being knocked unconscious at his partner's house. Sylvester arrives in paediatric A&E with his two-year-old son, who has cut his forehead on a visit to church, while 70-year-old builder Leonard has lost sensation down his left side and the medics are worried he may have suffered a stroke

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, as Roisin Conaty and Asim Chaudhry take on Jon Richardson and Josh Widdicombe. Bill Bailey is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as Lee Mack and Joe Wilkinson take on Jon Richardson and Jessica Knappett. Comedian Nigel Ng is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary follows the work of the stroke team at south London's King's College Hospital. Laura's family faces a big decision when the 72-year-old grandmother is found to have a blood clot on her brain, while father-of-three Nic, the over-40s National BMX Champion, collapses in reception after suffering an accident while training for a stunt. The medics also treat 83-year-old Marjorie, who is complaining of a pain behind her eye following a recent bout of shingles

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Brian, 74, is brought into King's by ambulance after falling backwards down a flight of stairs and being knocked unconscious at his partner's house. Sylvester arrives in paediatric A&E with his two-year-old son, who has cut his forehead on a visit to church, while 70-year-old builder Leonard has lost sensation down his left side and the medics are worried he may have suffered a stroke

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Geri Melville is originally from St Lucia, but moved to the UK when she was just nine. Now, she's ready to return to her roots with her husband Ian, by buying a holiday home together on the island she left almost 50 years ago. With a budget of 360,000 Laura Hamilton shows them five properties boasting views of the Caribbean Sea

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Driving Wars
programme.desc: Female motoring journalists take on three computer enthusiasts as the remote-controlled mayhem continues. Presented by Colin Murray

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Compilation of two features on classic cars and SUVs. The presenters immerse themselves in the world of classic cars, with Jeremy Clarkson in a Fiat 124 Spider, Richard Hammond in an MGB GT and James May in a Peugeot 304 Cabriolet. They also enter the realm of the sports utility vehicle as they find out what sort of SUV can be bought for just a few hundred pounds before putting them through a series of challenges

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team come to the aid of Manchester couple Rebecca and Steve, whose life was changed for ever when they found out they were expecting triplets. Two years on, Rebecca is becoming depressed by the state of their small, damp, dilapidated house, which is unsafe for the children. The builders have just nine days to bring the property up to date and give this tired mum and dad the space they need for their active offspring. Luckily, local tradespeople and other members of the community turn out in force to help

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The Train Truckers are on the clock this week as they attempt to move a 100-ton diesel engine to a gala extravaganza, as well as a 175-ton rail crane destined for Egypt

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: On the banks of the River Tamar, Rick visits a little-known mausoleum with a rather macabre story and takes to the waves with an inspirational organisation who offer therapy using the power of surfing. On the wild Atlantic coast, near Bedruthan Steps, he meets fellow chef Emily Scott, who recreates the meal she cooked for President Joe Biden during the recent G7 summit

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: In the town of Looe, Rick discovers a time when the Cornish were taken as slaves by Barbary Pirates. He joins one of the last fishing boats in St Mawes and uses the catch of lemon sole to make a delicious warm salad. In Newlyn, he meets two entrepreneur chefs who are cooking mackerel to perfection

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Leamington Spa, and the up-market town brings out the businessman in Heavy D who gets more than he bargained for in one auction

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Alton, Hampshire, where Linda is concerned that the other bidders are taking advantage of her superior knowledge and her looks. Meanwhile, Boudicca and Heavy D form more than just a business partnership, and Barry impresses with his dainty footwork

programme.title: Building Cars: Secrets of the Assembly Line
programme.desc: James tests his wheel fitting skills on the assembly line, Kate gets to the bottom of how manufacturers test car seats, and Ant heads to Germany to put his faith in a driverless car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Renaultsport Twingo 133 through a stringent examination in Belfast - with a helping hand from actor Ross Kemp. Richard Hammond samples the delights of racing airport vehicles, and James May takes the Vauxhall Insignia VXR for a drive in the company of Margaret Calvert, whose ideas were central to the design of modern British road signs. Film director Guy Ritchie is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and there is also a group test of high-performance off-roaders from BMW, Audi and Range Rover

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Compilation of two features on classic cars and SUVs. The presenters immerse themselves in the world of classic cars, with Jeremy Clarkson in a Fiat 124 Spider, Richard Hammond in an MGB GT and James May in a Peugeot 304 Cabriolet. They also enter the realm of the sports utility vehicle as they find out what sort of SUV can be bought for just a few hundred pounds before putting them through a series of challenges

programme.title: Cannonball
programme.desc: Andrew Flintoff hosts the action-packed game show, in which 24 contestants are tasked with traversing a series of water-based challenges and custom-made inflatable obstacles, each designed to test their speed, accuracy, height and distance. The most successful contestants then claim a chance to launch themselves 'cannonball-style' at a moving target on the surface of a deep-water tank, all in the hope of nabbing the show's 'priceless' Cannonball Cup. Frankie Bridge, Radzi Chinyanganya, Ryan Hand and Maya Jama all join Andrew at the poolside to commentate on the action

programme.title: Total Wipeout: Freddie & Paddy Takeover
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff and Paddy McGuinness provide the voiceover for classic clips from the adventure game show. Twenty brave men and women throw caution to the wind as they tackle a series of crazy obstacles - including the famous bouncy red balls - in a bid to make it through to the final three and the chance to win 10,000. In this edition, the contestants include a psychiatrist from London, a drama student from Leicester, and a bus driver from Derbyshire

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip brings him to northern Greece where he enjoys traditional dishes including veal stiffado and kotopita - which Rick declares to be the best chicken pie he has ever tasted. In the coastal city of Preveza he goes out prawn fishing and follows in the footsteps of poet Lord Byron visiting Messolonghi, a city where seafood is a highly regarded commodity. Rick also rolls up his own sleeves to cook his favourite Greek dishes of stuffed peppers and tomatoes and souvlaki

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas test their general knowledge skills in the week's penultimate edition

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Newsreader Naga Munchetty, actor-singer Jordan Stephens, actress Sally Lindsay and funnyman David O'Doherty continue the daily test of their skills, hosted by Richard Osman

programme.desc: A compilation of unseen material from this series of the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon. programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Guests Johnny Vegas, Ronni Ancona and Jimmy Carr join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme 'naval navigation' in this extended episode. Enter the DIY SOS builders, who set to work on designer Gabrielle Blackman's vision, although with just nine days to complete the task, they'll need help. Luckily, the local tradespeople are also out in force, giving their time and their skills for free

programme.title: Exploration Volcano
programme.desc: Volcano specialist and all-round daredevil Chris Horsley heads to volcano sites all over the globe that are wreaking havoc and threatening to destroy nearby populations. When an inconspicuous hill on the Spanish island of La Palma bursts open, one man watches on helplessly as his home and possessions are burned

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Rame Peninsula. Far from the traditional tourist track, this part of Cornwall is famed for its cliffs and beaches. It's also where he meets a beachcomber who has found some remarkable objects washed up on the shore

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Barry, Darren and Scotty get up front and personal, while Boudicca and Linda go nose to nose over an uplifting prize. Meanwhile, John gives Nat a hard time for blind bidding

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines the social significance of cars in the 20th century. He begins by travelling to Germany, Italy and Russia to examine how dictators kick-started the mobilization of the masses, finding tales of design brilliance, abject failure, war, fraud and double dealing. James also learns about how the British motor industry blew a gift-wrapped chance to rule the world and he gets his own back with a stunt that means bad news for one of the planet's most hated cars

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The hosts bid to prove that cars can be art by filling a gallery in Middlesbrough with motoring-related works, including a few creations of their own. programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer return to Scotland for their latest fishing trip. Having failed to catch a salmon in the River Tay, they hope to have more luck on the Tweed. They also try their hand at boat fishing and receive some mystical predictions from a familiar face

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer are joined by Feargal Sharkey for a trip to the River Lea in Hertfordshire, where Paul used to fish for perch with his friends when he was a teenager. Bob reads up on the wise words of 17th-century angler Izaak Walton and prepares a riverside picnic that brings back fond memories and leads to a reflection on the differences between teenage life in their 1970s youth and the present. Setting up home in a narrowbooat, he also prepares a dish Paul's mother used to make - corned beef and potato pie

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures once more on to the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide, beginning by travelling through Russia. He starts in the industrial city of Tula, before visiting Leo Tolstoy's former home of Yasnaya Polyana and learning how the author's life and works were intertwined with the railways. Michael then boards the train that runs from the Caspian Sea to Moscow, where he performs an important role in a dramatic opera at the Bolshoi Theatre, before exploring the beauty and history of St Petersburg and riding on the first railway ever built in Russia

programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Hampshire and Berkshire, as he continues his journey to Wolverhampton. His stop-off points include Stratfield Saye House, the stately home bequeathed by the nation to Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington, in 1817. He then heads to Aldershot Garrison, where he is put through his paces under military instruction. At St Michael's Abbey in Farnborough, Michael visits the tomb of French emperor Napoleon III and his family, before ending in Crowthorne, Berkshire, the home of Broadmoor high-security psychiatric hospital

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton begins in Wokingham, Berkshire, where the former politician finds out how demand from a growing number of rail commuters fuelled the development of the modern printing press. He then learns about a Tudor businessman who manufactured cloth in enormous volumes in Newbury, and ends this leg of his trip in Bradford on Avon, Wiltshire. programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores Scandinavia, braving one of the world's oldest rollercoasters in Copenhagen's Tivoli Gardens. He then crosses the Oresund Bridge linking Denmark to Sweden, retracing the journey of a train that carried a revolutionary Russian passenger on an epic voyage, before test-driving a vintage Volvo in Gothenburg. Crossing into Norway, Michael discovers how in 1913 the nation expressed its distinctively modern identity in plays, paintings and polar exploration

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Bohemia and Bavaria, beginning by exploring the art nouveau architecture of Czech Republic capital Prague. He then samples the sulphurous spa waters and wallows in peat and mud in Marianske Lazne, formerly known as Marienbad, before test driving a state-of-the-art passenger train made at the Skoda factory in Pilsen. Crossing the border into Germany, Michael encounters a fire-breathing dragon in Furth-im-Wald, and learns about an early 20th-century pioneer who laid the foundations for Munich's pre-eminence in science and technology

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets out to sample the delights of the Atlantic coasts of Spain and France, beginning in Bordeaux, where he uncovers a historic British connection to the region's wines. programme.desc: George Clarke helps more people make their period homes fit for modern life. On a cobbled street in Cheshire sits a Georgian town house that could be straight out of a Dickens novel. It may look very 18th-century on the outside, but inside George discovers that it's a 1980s horror show, having been stripped of its original features. It does have one unique feature, though - a first-floor conservatory on stilts. Can he find a way of getting its grandeur back? programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Andy and Nicky Bruce, who were building an experimental amphibious house on a small island on the Thames in Buckinghamshire. They spent 1.2million on one of the most ambitious Grand Designs ever, but the logistical headache of building on an island only accessible by a narrow footbridge soon became clear. Heavy machinery was swept away by the river, contractors were changed, and the site was hit by severe storms, causing delays and resulting in an unfinished and untested building. Kevin returns to find out what living on a regularly flooded piece of land is like, and whether the floating home performed when the river burst its banks in January 2015

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Paramedics call to say they are rushing in a critically ill one-day-old baby, a road worker is brought in after having his foot run over by a mini-digger and a woman seeks treatment following a surprising reaction to a beauty treatment. Sister Jane meets one of her heroes when Barnsley cricketing legend Dickie Bird arrives for a follow-up appointment

programme.title: Skin A&E
programme.desc: Dr Natalia Spierings performs a tricky mole removal from a patient's upper lip, and Dr Dev Shah meets the father of a dermatology prodigy

programme.title: 999: Emergency Call Out
programme.desc: A devastating car crash leads to a manhunt for the driver and two passengers, and a man suffers major fractures and brain damage after falling head-first on to concrete

programme.title: Ambulance: Code Red
programme.desc: Two men are injured after an explosion at a firm that specialises in the disposal of hazardous waste. Jay and Paul were both caught in a fireball and have burns on their faces. Jay also has burns on his hands and knees. Dr Katie White and critical care paramedic Karen Baker are immediately dispatched

programme.title: Killer at the Crime Scene
programme.desc: Laureline Garcia-Bertaux is reported missing, and five days later police find a female body buried in a shallow grave in a back garden

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Emily, a teenage girl with a long history of depression, comes to the surgery to seek advice about the anti-psychotic medication she is currently taking. Also, pensioner Patrick and his wife meet with doctors to discuss his recent behavioural changes and memory loss, hoping the doctors can establish if this is being caused by the onset of dementia

programme.desc: Cameras focus on Frank and Nick, who are at the Mad Munk, setting up for a new show - a surprise party for their friend Nigel's 60th. Narrated by John Thomson

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Cameras follow Marcus, the owner of his own car and van hire company who explains what his team can face on a busy day. John Thomson narrates

programme.title: Car Pound Cops: Give Me My Car Back!
programme.desc: Surrey Police are surprised when a learner motorcyclist pulls a dangerous wheelie on the road in front of them and, upon pulling over the biker, they uncover more violations. It's a day of action in Telford as the DVLA, local council and police join forces to rid the streets of untaxed vehicles. Enforcement officers Jo and Rowhan swoop in to seize a car that has been untaxed for 10 months, but the owner is keen to drive it away

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Kate faces trouble from unruly tenants, who became anti-social, and are now trying to sue her for serving them an eviction notice. Dhiren relates how the existing tenant of a house he bought stopped paying rent as soon as he took ownership, and Tim explains how a health scare left him seeking to sell his property - but a standing occupant refused to leave

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: During a busy spring bank holiday, the traffic cops deal with the effects of drink and drugs. A dangerous drunk, unlicensed and uninsured driver leads officers on a 20-minute chase through busy areas, while a suspected drugged driver runs across a supermarket car park to avoid arrest. The victims of a hit-and-run incident report a man who denies he was at the wheel

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers are on the look-out for a car linked to the theft of two motorbikes, but when they spot the vehicle parked up and it immediately races off forcing them into a chase. With stingers at the ready, it's not long before the getaway car's tyres are shredded and the suspects abandon the car and go on the run

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Sean uses a manual battering ram on a raid on a drug dealer's house, while Jim's pursuit of a speeding driver leads to some narcotic-related discoveries and there is a high-speed chase through the streets of Macclesfield. Jenno gets a faceful of pepper spray, Jim has to deal with a mouthy drink driver, and Tom hunts down a violent armed robber

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Handler Liam and his trusty sniffer dog Louis are called in to help officers who have collared a man attempting to make a break for it from a suspected stolen car, and are later asked to assist in tracking down a burglar, and solve the mystery of a young driver who claims to have been coerced into breaking the law by a family member

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The interceptors' skills are put to the test as they go in hot pursuit of tearaway teens and reckless youths. Jacko is on the hunt for a wanted teenager after he disappears in a housing estate and the interceptors are also hot on the heels of a stolen silver Micra

programme.title: Shoplifters & Scammers: At War with the Law
programme.desc: All available guards are urgently deployed when a Code 21 emergency call comes into the control room in West Orchards shopping centre in Coventry after a shoplifter runs out of a store after stealing a pair of trainers. Meanwhile, Lewis and dog handler Keith race to violent incident outside of the shopping centre after a fight breaks out inside a betting shop

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: While Leah sympathises with Tegan following Andrew's decision, the latter wrestles with having lied about his choice. Rose plans a romantic surprise for Mali at the farmhouse

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Mercedes can play whatever games she likes, but Remi loves Bree. Rose and Mali process some targeted vandalism

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A four-year-old boy with a cancerous tumour visits the surgery, suffering from ear pain which doctors believe could be an infection due to his weakened immune system after chemotherapy. Later, 19-year-old Holly returns to see the doctors worried that her lung cancer may have returned, and 72-year-old smoker Michael visits the surgery concerned that his ongoing back and chest pain may be a sign of cancer

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds (2000)
programme.desc: A veteran car thief is forced out of retirement to steal 50 top-of-the-range vehicles in exchange for his brother's life. While his sibling is held hostage by a sadistic gangster, he asks his former cronies to help - but with the clock ticking and just a few days remaining to pull off the daunting task, their chances of success are hanging by a thread. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Angelina Jolie, Giovanni Ribisi and Robert Duvall

programme.title: Shoplifters & Scammers: At War with the Law

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A suspect dies while being restrained by Ziva, who finds herself accused of using undue force and becomes the subject of an internal investigation. To make matters worse, Jenny is kidnapped by the dead man's brother, who demands a consignment of impounded heroin in exchange for her release. Drama, guest starring Connor Trinneer (Enterprise) and Tamara Taylor (Bones), with Mark Harmon, Cote de Pablo and Lauren Holly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gibbs is injured in an explosion while conducting inquiries aboard a ship. He lapses into a coma, during which he has flashbacks of the past he has always kept hidden. Meanwhile, Tony takes over the investigation, but his approach begins to cause friction

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gibbs emerges from his coma, but is suffering from amnesia - hindering the team's attempts to unravel a terrorist plot, as he is the only person likely to possess information on the would-be perpetrator's plans. Drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A cross-dresser is suspected of killing and dismembering a cantankerous former boxer - but the team is unable to find vital body parts, making it impossible for the medical examiner to prove the case is murder. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A Holocaust survivor is murdered shortly before she is due to testify at the trial of a former SS Officer stationed at a concentration camp, forcing McCoy to consider who stood to gain the most from the old woman's death - the alleged war criminal, or a music producer promoting racist records

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A respected district attorney is found dead in Central Park - and as Briscoe and Green investigate, they discover he was actually living under an assumed identity, and had never graduated from law school. To complicate matters, further inquiries link his murder to that of a journalist 10 years previously. Guest starring Michael Bloomberg

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A notorious radio DJ claims to have survived an attack by two men posing as chauffeurs. Fontana and Green are dubious at first, knowing he has a history of staging bogus assaults on himself, but the discovery that he is having an affair with a mobster's mistress prompts them to investigate further. However, proving the Mafia's involvement depends on a number of unreliable or unavailable witnesses. Dennis Farina and Jesse L Martin star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A jeweller with ties to the Russian Mob is shot dead in the middle of Times Square. It emerges that he had been helping the authorities bring his associates to justice, giving the detectives some obvious suspects. However, another man injured in the gunfire is later identified as one of the two shooters, bringing his accomplice and then the dead man's wife under suspicion

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Detectives Fontana and Green investigate the murders of a group of heroin users in a raid on a drug den. The prime suspect is a warlord who aided American forces in Afghanistan and claims diplomatic immunity - but McCoy and Southerlyn refuse to be swayed in their attempts to prosecute. Drama, starring Dennis Farina, Jesse L Martin, Sam Waterston and Elisabeth Rohm

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents try to track down an arms dealer who has the launch codes for the Navy's encrypted satellite defence system and is offering them to the highest bidder. In an attempt to win the confidence of the buyer, Ducky poses as an ageing Englishman trying to sell the information. Guest starring Armand Assante, with David McCallum and Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A sailor's body is discovered in a disused restaurant, and his death is initially ascribed to an accidental drug overdose. However, Abby discovers a message written in blood on a laminated card found at the scene and realises he was murdered. Meanwhile, Jimmy continues to pursue a relationship with Agent Michelle Lee

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A nuclear power plant inspector suffers radiation poisoning, forcing the team to consider the possibility that a foreign power deliberately targeted him. As the others investigate, Ziva spends time with the ailing victim - and begins to realise she is developing feelings for him. Drama, guest starring Matthew Marsden, with Cote de Pablo

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny's investigation into a man covered in rat bites and thrown from a car leads him to the door of a powerful socialite (guest star Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio). Meanwhile, Frank looks to turn the tables on a bigoted radio host. Drama, with Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives have their work cut out for them when three major cases all come in at midnight. Meanwhile, Tensions boil over between Rollins and Carisi

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The assault of a teenage girl leads to a shocking discovery. Benson has a short-lived, tragic reunion with someone from her past

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is murdered at the home of Gunnery Sergeant Holt Perkins, and while the victim is initially assumed to be the marine's wife, analysis reveals her to be a convicted thief, presumed to be on the scene as part of a plot to hit Perkins' house. When the agents discover the calling card of notorious terror cell Dragon's Tooth on the body, it becomes clear the murder has been committed as part of a wider agenda, and the team joins forces with the Department of Defence to catch the killer. American drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A prostitute and what seems to be one of her clients are gunned down in a drive-by shooting, and when it emerges that the would-be John was actually a Navy officer, Gibbs and DiNozzo realise the killings are connected Lex Tarlionas, an incomplete operation to bring justice to those responsible for an attack on a US airport in 1979, which left 100 people dead. The main suspect is a former Colombian drugs kingpin known as Tomas Orlando, and the murdered sex worker was about to hand over crucial DNA evidence that could have connected him to the crime, but now that she is dead, Gibbs and the others must find another way to finally bring Orlando in. American drama, starring Mark Harmon and David McCallum

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The conviction of a death row prisoner is called into question by the revelation that attorney-client privilege may have prompted a former prosecutor to withhold evidence capable of establishing his innocence. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part two of two. The wealthy and powerful Mulroney family is investigated for links to the Mafia, and Stabler hunts for Helen Katich, the only witness to Brecker's death - but her lifeless body is found in a car pulled from a river. However, the setback leads to a Mob hitman who provides information needed to pursue a case against the family

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Met Police helicopter India 99 is called to help rescue a woman who jumped into the Thames near the Palace of Westminster, as well as her two daughters, who leapt in after her. Elsewhere, the helicopter team coordinates a risky game of cat-and-mouse as police chase a group of graffiti artists across live train tracks in a patch of industrial wasteland in Battersea. The episode also looks at the case of the Hounslow Slasher, a man who in 2012 randomly attacked lone women while they were travelling home at night. Nick Wallis presents

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony and the team try to prove Ziva had nothing to do with a political assassination carried out by her former Mossad partner - but have to tackle the case without Gibbs, who has retired to Mexico and now spends his time building boats. Naval crime drama, starring Cote de Pablo and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Against his better judgement, Gibbs comes out of retirement to help Fornell and his daughter, whose lives are being threatened by an escaped convict. The team reopens the criminal's case and questions a former sailor, the only person to have contacted him while he was in jail. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette, with Hal Holbrook

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A missing US Navy lieutenant's car is found covered in blood, and the team discovers she had been profiling men to find the perfect partner. When further investigations reveal she had planned to attend a seminar at a local hotel, Ziva goes undercover in a bid to find out more. Meanwhile, Jenny makes Tony a secret offer

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green attend the scene of a double homicide at an exclusive restaurant. It transpires that one of the victims was a respected Hollywood producer - and had made enemies in the criminal underworld after filming a movie about the Mafia. Starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A bar-room brawl results in a baseball player being killed, leading Briscoe and Green to suspect a sporting grudge is behind the killing. However, a very different vendetta comes to light as the evidence points to a man recently exonerated after serving 20 years in prison for murder. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A Japanese businessman survives a shooting incident in which his wife was killed, and later claims they were attacked by a black gunman. However, Briscoe and Green begin to suspect he is attempting to stir up racial prejudice in a bid to conceal the fact they were actually targeted by yakuza mobsters from his native country. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A convicted child murderer is struck and left for dead by a motorist just weeks after his prison release, but Fontana and Green are initially unenthusiastic about finding out who ran him over. It is not until the killer dies from his injuries that they investigate inside the prison where he served his sentence - and uncover evidence that leads McCoy to make a startling discovery. Starring Dennis Farina

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A wealthy man is found beaten to death in his home, prompting detectives Fontana and Green to suspect the victim's wife and the contractor who installed the security system. McCoy and Southerlyn investigate an affair between the two, and seek to turn them against each other, but a second unexpected crime slows down their case

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A rap producer is found shot dead in his studio and suspicion falls on one of his proteges, a hip-hop artist whose lyrics describe a similar killing. Police link a previous murder to the case, but Southerlyn's opinions put her sharply at odds with McCoy as the investigation unfolds. Starring Dennis Farina and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An explosion at a mausoleum exposes a number of freshly dismembered bodies, prompting the team to launch a multiple murder investigation to identify the victims. Meanwhile, Abby has a personal problem to deal with - and it seems Gibbs is the only person she will confide in. Drama, starring Pauley Perrette and Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A supposedly dead marine suddenly regains consciousness on the autopsy table, leaving the team struggling to solve the mystery of how he came to be in such a strange predicament. Investigations reveal he had recently been on a trip to Baghdad - and uncover an unexpected link to Gibbs' past. Drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The unit is tipped off about terrorist activity, and two agents are murdered during the ensuing investigation. Believing the information to be a set-up, the team tries to solve the case with assistance from a guilt-stricken Paula Cassidy, who holds herself responsible for the tragedy. Drama, starring Jessica Steen

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee feels the pressure as the team investigates a double murder that appears to be inspired by his still unpublished new novel. His sense of guilt is compounded by the realisation that one of his colleagues could become the killer's third target. American drama following the work of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service, starring Sean Murray and Mark Harmon

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The squad joins forces with an undercover task force to take down a human trafficking ring. Starring Mariska Hargitay and Kelli Giddish

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson helps the victims of drugging and assault separate their hallucinations from their memories, as Rollins hunts for the suspect

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo teams up with his girlfriend, ATF agent Zoe Keates, to investigate the circumstances surrounding the death of a US Marine in what initially seems like a simple road accident. The team reveals the dead man did indeed die due to a broken neck sustained during a crash, but someone shot at him first. As DiNozzo and Keates pursue their inquiry, they discover the victim's death is connected to a controversial ATF plan to place traceable firearms in the criminal system, and then follow them to the heads of crime organisations. Naval crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US marine visits the home of his former captain, only to find the man has been killed, and the killer is waiting inside the property. While the soldier escapes with his life, the attacker gets away too. It quickly emerges the prime suspect is Qasim, an Afghan translator evidence, and evidence points against him, until it is discovered he has a brother, who is loyal to the Taliban. The subsequent chain of evidence leads Gibbs and Bishop to Afghanistan

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives trace the identities of two murdered teenagers and discover one had a sister who was travelling with them. Physical evidence implicates her in the crimes, but she claims to have been an unwilling accomplice. Ellen Pompeo (Grey's Anatomy) guest stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Fontana and Green investigate the murder of a woman by a suicidal man and discover a cult that promotes sexual relationships with children. programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

The team discovers Kern has been researching ways to artificially create Alphas, but when an invisible stranger infiltrates the facility, it appears his work might be about to fall into the wrong hands. Guest starring Brent Spiner (Star Trek: The Next Generation) and Rebecca Mader (Lost)

programme.title: A Kiss Before Dying (1956)
programme.desc: A psychopathic college student is horrified to learn his girlfriend is pregnant, threatening his chances of being accepted into her well-to-do family. In a fit of fury, he murders her and makes it look as if she had committed suicide - only for her sister to show up, taking an uncomfortable degree of interest in the manner of her sibling's death. Thriller, with Robert Wagner, Joanne Woodward, Jeffrey Hunter and Mary Astor

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.desc: Riding an historic Tiger Moth bi-plane, Griff Rhys Jones arrives in the humid tropics of Darwin. He encounters a crocodile and an iconic news editor, before travelling through the night on a road train, arriving in the 'red centre' of Alice Springs - only to be surprised by the lush green sporting fields and the mysterious Americans playing baseball there. The presenter gets some tips on how to survive in the desert from an Aboriginal elder, before riding into the sunset on a camel - in tribute to the Afghan cameleers for which the legendary Ghan passenger train is named

programme.title: Screen Two

programme.desc: A mischievous otter faces a fight for survival in the wild from birth, as it leaves the nest and strikes out alone. Wildlife adventure based in Henry Williamson's novel, narrated by Peter Ustinov and starring Peter Bennett, Edward Underdown and Brenda Cavendish

programme.desc: Discover the stories behind the personal items and belongings left behind in Auschwitz Birkenau, a former nazi concentration and extermination camp, the world's largest cemetery and resting place. Part 5 of 5.

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores Skomer Island, a seabird haven off the Pembrokeshire coast, and watches members of its puffin population returning from the sea with sand eels to feed their young. He also has a close encounter with the Skomer vole, which is not found anywhere else

programme.title: The Happy Valley (1986)
programme.desc: A teenager grows up in a society of British aristocrats in 1940s Kenya, where the colonial settlers indulge in a life of debauchery. When one resident is shot and killed, she finds herself in the difficult position of being the only one who knows what really happened - a truth many would prefer to stay buried. Fact-based period drama, starring Denholm Elliott and Holly Aird

programme.title: Detachment (2011)
programme.desc: A substitute teacher drifts from school to school, actively trying to avoid making emotional connections with either colleagues or pupils. When he takes a placement at a school with an apathetic student body and a frustrated administration, he finds himself becoming an unlikely role model. Drama, starring Adrien Brody, Marcia Gay Harden and James Caan

programme.title: Big Boys Don't Cry (2020)
programme.desc: A man recalls his harrowing childhood growing up in a children's home following a police investigation into his boyhood friend's suicide. Drama, starring Michael Socha

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Blitz Spirit
programme.desc: Documentary series offering an insight into life for Londoners during the Blitz, which left much of the capital destroyed and claimed 30,000 lives, widening the gulf between rich and poor. The programme features personal testimony from people who lived through the period, and reveals how government information films and the Press played down much of the devastation. Narrated by Christopher Timothy

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears

A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: Odd Man Out (1947)
programme.desc: An IRA operative stages a robbery to steal funds for his cause, but as he makes his getaway he is wounded by the police and forced to go on the run. Staggering through the backstreets of Belfast, the fugitive encounters a succession of people either willing to help him - or determined to turn him in. Carol Reed's thriller, based on the book by FL Green, with James Mason, Robert Newton and Kathleen Ryan

programme.title: On the Fiddle (1961)
programme.desc: A Second World War black marketeer is arrested, but a judge forces him to join the army rather than sending him to prison. He soon finds a willing accomplice in an easy-going fellow recruit, and together they concoct a variety of underhanded schemes to avoid being sent to the front line. Comedy based on RF Delderfield's novel, starring Alfred Lynch and Sean Connery

programme.title: The King and Four Queens (1956)
programme.desc: A gambler visits a ranch owned by the mother of four infamous outlaw brothers. He hopes to discover the location of buried treasure stolen by the criminal family, but finds himself fending off the advances of the bandits' seductive wives, all of whom hope to escape their absent husbands and make off with the loot. Western, with Clark Gable, Eleanor Parker and Jo Van Fleet

programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: The Lion Queen
programme.desc: The work of Andi Rive, who abandoned her city life to run a lion sanctuary in South Africa and raise awareness about a species that is facing extinction

programme.title: Peeping Tom (1960)
programme.desc: The son of a psychologist develops a fetish for murdering women and recording their final death throes on film, a twisted and gruesome version of his father's own voyeuristic experiments in which he recorded his son obsessively throughout every moment of his childhood. Michael Powell's psychological thriller, starring Carl Boehm, Anna Massey, Moira Shearer, Esmond Knight and Maxine Audley

programme.title: Let Him Have It (1991)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the controversial 1952 murder trial in which 19-year-old Derek Bentley was sentenced to be hanged for killing a policeman - even though his friend Chris Craig was the one who fired the fatal gunshot. Starring Christopher Eccleston, Paul Reynolds, Tom Courtenay, Eileen Atkins, Tom Bell and Mark McGann

programme.title: Live DP World Tour Golf
programme.desc: The Omega European Masters. Live coverage of day one from Crans-sur-Sierre Golf Club in Switzerland. South Africa's Thriston Lawrence will be looking to defend the title that he won last year, while England's Matthew Fitzpatrick is aiming to win this competition for the third time in his career. Other winners of this tournament include Sergio Garcia, Danny Willett and Ernie Els

programme.title: Live US Open Tennis
programme.desc: Live coverage of day four from Billie Jean King National Tennis Centre at Flushing Meadows in New York, featuring matches in the second round. World number one Iga Swiatek prevailed 6-3, 6-2 against 2017 champion Sloane Stephens en route to the title at this stage last year, and Jessica Pegula was also a straight-sets winner against Aliaksandra Sasnovich. In the men's competition, eventual champion Carlos Alcaraz won 6-1, 6-2, 7-5 against Federico Coria, and his Spanish compatriot Rafael Nadal came back from a set down to eliminate Fabio Fognini

programme.title: Live US Open Tennis
programme.desc: Live coverage of day five from Billie Jean King National Tennis Centre at Flushing Meadows in New York, featuring matches in the third round. Andy Murray, who was a champion here in 2012, was eliminated at this stage last year when he was beaten 6-4, 6-4, 6-7, 6-3 by Matteo Berrettini. In the women's competition, Coco Gauff dominated an all-American clash with Madison Keys, before a home favourite's tournament came to an end when Serena Williams lost to Ajla Tomljanovic in three sets

programme.title: Live FNF
programme.desc: Luton Town v West Ham United (Kick-off 8.00pm). Live coverage of the Premier League clash from Kenilworth Road, as the two clubs face each other for the first time since 1994. The hosts are unbeaten against the Hammers in four meetings, with two of those encounters taking place in the FA Cup. This will be Luton's first home Premier League match after their opening game against Burnley was postponed due to delays in construction at their ground

programme.title: Live FNF
programme.desc: Luton Town v West Ham United (Kick-off 8.00pm). Live coverage of the Premier League clash from Kenilworth Road, as the two clubs face each other for the first time since 1994. The hosts are unbeaten against the Hammers in four meetings, with two of those encounters taking place in the FA Cup. This will be Luton's first home Premier League match after their opening game against Burnley was postponed due to delays in construction at their ground

programme.title: Live: SNF
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Newcastle United (Kick-off 5.30pm). Live coverage of the Premier League clash from AMEX Stadium. The visitors are unbeaten in four games against their South coast opponents, having won two and drawn two in the previous two seasons. The last meeting at the end of last season saw the Magpies hammer the Seagulls 4-1 to move themselves to within one win of Champions League qualification
